review:
I was just forced off the app due to poor internet connectivity. I was in the middle of choosing a champ for a match, and it kept lagging.. then I was logged out. The app had trouble rebooting. I tried to log back in again and it said the servers were down. Then I opened it again and it took ages to load.. so I changed my WiFi server. And it finally worked. However, I was punished for not being present in the game. That‚Äôs not fair, considering that it wasn‚Äôt even my fault. The sensors for when a player is having connectivity issues need to be sharper. Please and thank you !

Also, Riot, please stop deactivating accounts that aren‚Äôt active for over a year or two! Someone I know got back into the game after years hiatus and he had to make a new account. He had already spent 100s of dollars on his old account. Please change this Riot. 

But I love this game a lot. It‚Äôs the only game on my phone I actually play every day.
review_title: I love this game, but some things need improvement

review: What an incredibly fun game! I haven‚Äôt spent this much time on a game on my phone in a very long time. I played LoL on my pc before wild rift and I can say I almost prefer wild rift! Hopefully one day they will add the rest, or at least more, of the champions. There still is a large selection of champions to choose from and I also like the smaller map a little better. Really fun casual game that can also be taken more seriously with ranked matches if that‚Äôs what you prefer. Hopefully they continue to push the updates with more content and missions to keep the game interesting. The only real problem I have is sometimes it seems like it take a long time to collect blue motes to unlock champions. I know they don‚Äôt want you to be able to just unlock them all in one day and they also need to make money on cosmetics and people who don‚Äôt wanna grind. It‚Äôs not really that big of a deal that‚Äôs why I still have five stars for the review.

Wild Rift is the next evolution for League of Legends, an upgraded engine, upgraded models, quicker games and as the title implies a ‚ÄúWild Rift‚Äù. 
The map is varied and randomized allowing for on the fly gameplay changes. 

For anyone saying the touch screen combat is clunky I have to disagree, once I got used to the controls I was stomping on people. Being able to run while autoing and the ability to quick cast on character direction/placement allows for some quick twitch reactions that main client just doesn't allow and makes escapes much more possible and reliable rather than having to just give up and let the enemy team kill you because you‚Äôre too slow. 

The only cons I have with Wild Rift is that there‚Äôs a lack of item variety, having more active items like galeforce or zz‚Äôrot would allow strategy and gameplay to breath and make choices more important. I also think Runes would be better if they were the full system from main game rather than the weird mixed tier system currently implemented, not being able to use Dark Harvest on Jhin is no fun, if I‚Äôm mobbing the enemy I should be able to have a high risk high reward rune that supports my play style if I‚Äôm doing good. If you could Riot, please add some modern client features such as Legendary items, potions, additional runes and more boot options.  

As a Jhin main 3.2 mil mastery, Wild Rift is an absolute pleasure to play. Thank you Riot.
review_title: I have played league since 2012 (Diamond III)

review: Idk why but for some reason I feel like your reporting method isn‚Äôt working? I keep getting paired with trash players who intentionally feed and often time it‚Äôs the same player after I reported it. For instance player ‚Äúpipluppiplup‚Äù literally said he‚Äôs going to troll when game started and then proceeded to run into the towers in a rank match. Next game I get paired with this player again and he proceeds to do it again. Player ‚ÄúElmigue97‚Äù decided he didn‚Äôt want to jungle last second and instead lane with adc and support as akali. He then comes down to my lane where I am nasus and then proceeds to take my creep then goes back to base or into the tower. It‚Äôs honestly pretty annoying when players like this are ruining the game. The reporting system isn‚Äôt working I think. People going afk because it is a mobile game so I guess penalties are not severe. CONCLUSION. If you enjoy league of legends or the basic 5v5 type of game you will enjoy this. But if you hate playing with toxic players you are better off playing Mobile Legends
review_title: Great game but one MAJOR fall back

review: The game is a very good adaptation of the PC game as a result, it suffers from the same issues as the original. The year is 2023 and Riot Game enforce this arcade matchmaking system that artificially match you up with bad players so you are kept at a 50% win rate. This level of manipulation only serves to kill the competitive spirit of anyone who plays for rank. I wouldn‚Äôt mind these issues if matches were short but matches are long and require you to invest a considerable amount of time. If you are match up with a bad teammate or teammates you will waist all of that time for nothing. You will drop in rank and waist your time. Matches results are black and white so no partial credit is giving to you for being MVP if your team lose. If you have a win streak you will be push down to a point where your win rate is back to 50%. The people who do well in rank don‚Äôt solo queque so they avoid matchmaking with randoms. They are not particularly more skill than a lot of people. If you read this and still go and play this game I wish you the best but remember there many other games that won‚Äôt manipulate you or waist your time.

So I want to say before anything, that I love this game, and the whole universe it has created. With that out of the way, let‚Äôs get into some of the gritty details. So, having played both the pc and mobile versions of this game, I can say without a doubt that the way do move a champion around in mobile version is 500% better. The attack buttons are well spaced and intuitive and movement is super responsive. Only the map is a bit out of place. Now I could completely overlook the issues with the map, if it wasn‚Äôt for the fact that the app crashes 1-3 times per match. I mean, I just started a ranked match not 30 minutes ago, and after 5 minutes into the match, the app crashed and continued to disconnect 6 more times. Each time I was 3% away from loading back into the game. I understand that the iPhone 5 is no longer supported, but this is far beyond a simple performance impact. Please fix these crashes I beg you.

First of all I want to say this game is gold, it‚Äôs unlike many others (aside from MLBB but that‚Äôs like wild rift not the other way around) the graphics are amazing the gameplay is amazing and overall really fun game.

My huge problem with this game is that sometimes I enter a match and it says I am unable to connect even though my wifi speed is high and I have all bars, I have turned my wifi off and on to try and reconnect but it just never lets me, I know this is still an early stage of the game but that‚Äôs besides the point, the thing is after a minute of trying or so it just lets me out of the match which of course makes me happy that I don‚Äôt have to play a game from behind but sometimes those games are the ones where everything seems perfect and we have a good comp and stuff.

PS, there should be a way to organize which pings you want to send out first, (I usually use the group ping but I have to scroll for that) like which 3 pings you want to have at the ready

So I‚Äôve played league for a long time on PC and I am very familiar with punishments being a thing for leavers and what not. The issue with this system in a Mobile game especially a multiplayer game is that there is a ways times when you may drop connection. It‚Äôs a MOBILE game. If I wanted to play league on at home I‚Äôd just play it on pc. The whole point of having this kind of a game is that you can play it while out in about. It‚Äôs not that I‚Äôm consistent but after about 3 times of me dropping connection for whatever one reason or another I am can be punished by being banned from regular play. Another instance of something like this happening is I was trying to play against the AI in a custom match but I forgot to change to a custom match before clicking the play button and the game launch jumped on my screen and obviously I knew my connection was spotty so I declined the game. I then received a penalty for not accepting a match for the FIRST TIME! This is ridiculous that I am being penalized for not accepting a match 1 time an d should be changed.

review:
What really tweaks my melon is when I'm playing Lulu and I get no metal at the end. Just some metal, not asking for an A or S rating. You see, I've set up at least two memorable game winning penta-kills and when the end screen comes up, it looks like I did nothing the entire game. I'm quite sure other players feel the same way with what ever support they play, but Lulu specifically has an unique kit that allows her teammates to snowball the game like no other support can. My point is supports aren't getting enough love!!!

Other than that, I've enjoyed the game. I do wish it was more like the PC version and you guys didn't chicken out on making that version for the mobile app but whatever. Nothing I can do about that but ask for that game. You have the market, I think, that would gladly play the extended version on their phone especially the PCers. 

If I get nothing more than that trophy, well, at least I got something out of this.

League of Legends: Wild Rift is a poor parody of the traditional PC game. The mobile adaptation features a simplified version that seems to be appealing to the younger and more casual audience to draw in more players to the franchise, which is fine, but the game itself is very dumbed down. For existing fans you‚Äôll have to slog through a tutorial section, that although can be partially skipped, forces you to play a full scale game against A.I. opponents which is just a waste of time. Additionally, the control scheme the developers have implemented is very unwieldy and clunky to try and use, so it compensates for that with auto-aim mechanics that significantly lower the amount of skill players require to succeed, handholding the player to give them an artificial feeling of success when the game did all the work for them. This game could seriously benefit from changing the controls to something similar to what is seen in Vainglory, which utilizes touch controls in a much simpler and more effective way, with far less clutter on the screen. The lack of effort on delivering even half the quality and care as the traditional game comes off as just a cash grab, and is sad to see in such a sorry state.
developerResponse: {'id': 21971970, 'body': 'Please reach out to us with a ticket at https://support-wildrift.riotgames.com/ and we can figure out what happened!', 'modified': '2021-03-31T13:04:35Z'}

review: The matchmaking needs a serious overhaul. I can get over the constant targeting issues with skill shot high mobility champions, I can even get over my flash or ignite suddenly not working when it would win me a fight (happens constantly for the last year). I cannot however get over how bad the matchmaking has become. I am almost always paired with entire teams that just feed the whole game leading to us being stomped on, over and over and over again. The first year and a half of having this game was great (I don‚Äôt own a pc anymore so having league again meant alot) but the matchmaking in ranked and normals makes games so one sided it‚Äôs not even fun to play anymore. I have around 8 thousand total games played in league of legends, I can take a loss deserved. I can get over the occasional connection problems that ruin a game every now and again. I‚Äôve never felt so disheartened towards playing another game though, when game after game is toxic teammates that feed all game and then blame me or talk crap all game. Please fix this! The pc version never had issues this bad, please implement similar matchmaking ASAP.

So I play on pc as well as the mobile version so coming from someone with a riot account on pc, if you have any skins or progress with certain characters you will have to re-buy them if you want them on mobile. It Doesn't get rid of anything on pc when you play the mobile version. But you do have to restart essentially on the mobile version. A lot of the characters feel the same but they don‚Äôt have a few items that pc has and still catching up characters wise, so if you like playing vigar or any other recently added pc character you have a long time to wait‚Ä¶ All in all though it plays and feels almost just like the pc and all the ability‚Äôs work just like pc. Oh, they don‚Äôt have inhibitor towers, instead when you clear a lane of all 3 towers, that‚Äôs when the super minions get deployed. Jungle is exactly the same with its respective placement and buffs.

the player base is already cancer‚Äî as expected from a game derived from league of legends‚Ä¶ but the ranked matchmaking and game design make wild rift unplayable at times. massive amounts of trolls who seemingly don‚Äôt get any meaningful punishments for their actions, as well as afks, plague this dying game.

for those of us trying to enjoy the game, matchmaking is a huge turnoff. it really feels like the algorithm works against you to make your winrate as close to 50%‚Äî very frustrating. Id much rather have longer queue times for higher quality teammates and matches. Instead, I encounter people who ban my declared champion, afks 1 minute into the game, players two tiers below who barely have a grasp of the game‚Ä¶

besides all these flawed aspects of wild rift, the UI and special events clearly have a lot of thought and effort put into them; so riot/tencent please fine tune the matchmaking and actually punish griefers so that the beautiful parts of this game can be properly appreciated and enjoyed!! :)) wild rift is deserving of at least a 4 star rating with these issues fixed. thanks for reading xx

review: The amount of terrible low rating reviews that is quite apparent is from those who have never actually played a mobile MOBA is hilarious. Other equally amusing reviews consist of people who thought this was a 1 for 1 port of League and is mad their skins didn‚Äôt transfer and those who failed to take a rudimentary look at the control settings to configure them to suit them. The game is in a far superior place compared to its competitors (Jesus, try playing this and switching to AoV or god forbid OA) even in its early days as of 2.2 and the quality and polish shows in even a single game against bots. Don‚Äôt rate this game lowly because you lack basic knowledge or just brain cells in general and can‚Äôt figure out how to operate a mobile device. No wonder so many players play worse than actual CPUs when you got folks who can‚Äôt figure out how portrait locking or drag targeting works.

The game is amazing, the graphics are great and the controls are good too. But what I noticed while I was playing League of Legends for few rounds, I noticed that you can easily earn gold (fast giving gold) and by you reach like lvl 5 and up you already have two skills. I don‚Äôt know if that is too fast for getting gold without farming at all. It‚Äôs a flaw because players can easily level up and win, and it‚Äôs more fun if players are able to work for theirs skills and lvl up. Rather than easily getting what you want and then just win just like that. For short it‚Äôs too easy to get your skills. In addition, the ‚ÄúPinging‚Äù are like too complex, it would be easier if there‚Äôs just like an exclamation point on the bottom of the map and alert your team, rather having 4 or 3 options to drag your finger to alert or signal. But it‚Äôs a good game overall it‚Äôs just need to be more competitive and easy to map everything out.

I‚Äôve always wanted to like LoL, but the games just take too long for my limited time.  I played hots on pc for a while but stopped after blizzard gave up support for organized play and big tournaments.  

I‚Äôve tried all of the mobile mobas and in my opinion this one is the best.  It‚Äôs still very early in its development cycle and is very polished.  I don‚Äôt have a ton of time to dedicate to these types of games, but I do enjoy playing them.  Are there some issues with wildrift?  Of course,  but I feel fairily confident that the devs are working to implement a better ping system and in general looking to make the game better.  I love that it‚Äôs not constantly begging me to check out some sort of ad or try to figure out the millions of in game ‚Äúclick on this so you can get that‚Äù.  Mobile legends killed me with these.  Anyway, I really enjoy this game.  Thanks for making it!
review_title: Cleanest implementation of moba on mobile

review: Game is full of bots in PvP matchmaking. Not sure if it‚Äôs account sellers trying to make money or Riot trying to make the game seem more populated. I didn‚Äôt notice it too much until a month ago. But now I‚Äôve played about 40 games in the last week and it‚Äôs very obvious. I‚Äôve played WR since it‚Äôs release and it‚Äôs easy to differentiate between a new player and an AI. The bots will run down the lane and hard int, move in notably odd patterns, miss every single skill shot by a mile, roam to any lane at any time to int there, 0 communication. It‚Äôs especially rampant in unranked, but still very common in ranked (granted I can‚Äôt speak on anything that above plat 2 but bots shouldn‚Äôt be that high anyways). Ruins the fun of winning when it‚Äôs just stomping the other team that happened to get more bots than you. Waste of time to lose when you‚Äôre on the team with mostly bots and their team is 20-0 in the first 10min with all objectives. Pretty fun if you‚Äôre lucky enough to somehow get a match full of actual players. 5/5 if it didn‚Äôt have a bot infestation, 2/5 currently.

review:
Great MOBA ruined by connectivity issues. I have tried multiple devices, multiple ISPs, different locations, and configurations and this game continues to be unplayable (in case some genius from Riot chimes in about updating my software or checking my network yes I have done all of that and your game is still a laggy mess). There are major bugs with Lee Sin and Senna in particular causing lag spikes in team fights or missing visual effects. Wild Rift is a fun experience when it works and mind numbingly frustrating all other times. My advice to anyone interested would be to play early in the morning if possible. I have purchased several Wild Passes but do not recommend purchasing them in the future until Riot fixes their network issues.

Update: I have been contacted by Riot to submit a support ticket but I have already submitted six support tickets in the last six months for these issues. I stand by my previous statements in that this game is fun when it works but that is a rare occurrence and most of the time you will be frustrated.

review: Literally I am tempted to delete because it lags too much. My own friends lag out of no where and it is quite inconvenient when it happens in the beginning of the match and continues until the end. In so many matches, I have to literally be useless because I can‚Äôt see my character moving or straight up get disconnected. The ping spike is extremely annoying and the thing is, my WiFi is fine. The connection is strong. Wild rift also takes a lot of storage and it‚Äôs inconvenient. The game is okay but kinda boring and there‚Äôs not much to it. Honestly would rather play a different MOBA since they take less space and have more better connection. Also please fix the hacker issues. The amount of times I lag because I get close to a specific player is kinda annoying and also the amount of snipes is also annoying. Like.. no wards, no vision but they are able to just snipe me? Yea, kinda suspicious and those people probably don‚Äôt even get punished. I‚Äôm keeping the game for my friends but really‚Ä¶ I think I might delete it since there are other games that are better.

review:
Look, I love games, and this one is amazing. It has tons of characters that you can unlock and many different ways to play it. You can invite friends to play along and have a blast. I also love how you can for y out any character as many times as you want. But as great as this game is I have one big problem. I love games but if I have to leave of I need to get up and do something I will always do it over a game. Most games don‚Äôt have a problem with this but this one does. It says that if you leave while playing in a match which can take up to 30 minutes  the it is a ‚Äúpunishable offense‚Äù. It then blocks you form playing for 10 seconds which sounds ok at first but the time keeps on going up and can go into hours or days you can‚Äôt play the game because you had to leave it. 
I think that this rule is horrible and needs to be handled for this game to deserve a 5 star rating.

A lot of people compare this game to the pc variant and complain how the controls are wonky and the mechanics don‚Äôt work the same way. And they‚Äôre right: it is a very different game. People who come to this game expecting league pc on mobile are often the people who end up disappointed. And it‚Äôs on them for feeling that way. Having played several other top MOBAs I can confidently say that this game tops the rest. Although of course, the game feels more fun to play because of some dabbling in league pc before, it‚Äôs definitely the little details on character design, skins, and interactive events that make this game standout. If you‚Äôre looking for a game with decently balanced characters and exciting team fights this is a good one to pick up. And for those of you still complaining it‚Äôs not league on mobile, stop whining and go play on your pc instead.
review_title: A very good MOBA‚Äînot league mobile

review: The game itself is great, I love playing it and seeing the work the developers put into it. The slow release of champions and lack of game modes is a bit dull but the game itself is just so fun that I really don‚Äôt mind. The BIGGEST complaint I have about this game is the lag. Not like just a casual spike here or there, this game is essentially unplayable in a competitive setting. Whenever more than three characters are on the screen the game slows to a halt and I‚Äôm left with an uncontrollable character glitching around my screen getting sliced and diced by the enemy. No other game from CoD mobile to PUBG have I had issues with in regards to ping. This game even lets you network test and my router is around 9ms which is great. However the ‚Äúmatch server delay‚Äù is ridiculous. I live outside of New York which is an advantage in getting a good server connection, but this game is just consistently and constantly having spikes that ruin the experience. It‚Äôs frustrating and discouraging and I truly hope it gets fixed.

First off great game, as a person who can‚Äôt handle 1hr games of LeagueOfLegend, wild rift was a great way to enjoy League but with quicker gameplay. Sadly the amount of trolls in the game has increased too much. How do they troll you may ask? Stealing positions, choosing heroes that don‚Äôt fit their selected roles, afk after only 10min of gameplay, and so on. I understand that every player has a choice when it comes to choosing heroes, but it is fundamentally crucial that this hero at least fits their lane or role somewhat. For example mage/spellcasters as a jungle? It is Incredibly hard to get a good game from that composition. And yes I have communicated with these players but it does nothing and reports does nothing either. At first I noticed players trolling in casual, but now they troll even in rank. I am emerald 2 and have constantly been paired with these trolls. I was hoping that I could escape these trolls from casual but they seem to enjoy ruining games in rank even more since they‚Äôre teammates would be losing rank. I‚Äôm so tired of this crap that I have decided not to play anymore. Great game, bad community!

TLDR: not perfect but much better than other mobas, even PC. Ranking system, good. Combat system, fast paced a little random. Free to play? Yes. Pay to win? No but some nice content available to buy.

This game as a whole is in such a better state than PC league, I‚Äôve played that version since 2011 and I‚Äôve been through all of the ups and downs over there. I played wild rift since season 2, peaked diamond 1 took 2 seasons off to try league again and realized there is no way I‚Äôll ever hit that rank on PC so i‚Äôm back on wild rift to try and hit challenger. The addition of new champs is really nice to see. And if you queue fill you actually get a chance to play every roll not just what is unpopular in the meta. It‚Äôs much easier as a new player to learn the game and mistakes or cold streaks are much more forgiving. 

If I could change anything it would be to increase all cool downs to make fights last longer.
review_title: Don‚Äôt read into the negative reviews

review: Riot has done an excellent job convert League of Legends into an experience that feels good on a mobile device. I was so skeptical a year or two ago when they announced they were working on this. I‚Äôve put many hours into League of Legends and couldn‚Äôt see how you could capture the experience without the precision of a mouse and keyboard. I love the auto aim system. They‚Äôve done it in a way that helps make up for not having a mouse, but you are still punished if you don‚Äôt Hearn to take control and aim yourself in most cases. It feels great. The game is also so much faster. I rarely have matches go over 15-20 min. One of the reasons I stopped playing on PC was the 60min + match times. Good job, Riot. I‚Äôm playing this every day. Honestly I don‚Äôt know what people are expecting when they give this lower than a 4 star. Do they want the moon?
review_title: There is no reason to not give 5 stars!

review: The gameplays alright, the graphics are nice, the match making isn‚Äôt too long‚Ä¶ however the problem comes with people trolling and deliberately throwing games (I‚Äôm not talking about someone who doesn‚Äôt do good in a game or someone whose just unlucky) I‚Äôm talking about those people who intentionally do things like ban their own teams champion picks and intentionally feed and throw lanes or objectives. There‚Äôs a lot of these people especially once you get into platinum or emerald league ranked matches (I would know I‚Äôve spent the entire season trying to get into diamond) this game is really only good if you play it in parties with people who you know aren‚Äôt trolls or who aren‚Äôt going to intentionally throw the game. That being said if these people didn‚Äôt exist this would be a 5/5 review and not a 4/5. You can‚Äôt take this game to seriously either unless your playing in a clan or party because you will rage, you have been warned!

I downloaded this game after watching and loving Arcane. I have never played LOL before and am new to the champions, abilities, and mechanics. Every game I try my best and I practice often with the Co-op vs AI mode which is very fun but whenever I play PVP and it‚Äôs not even ranked people make fun of me and bad mouth me in the chat and say to report me. Why are so many people playing this game so mean! I don‚Äôt have a lot of time to play games and I just want to have fun. It‚Äôs very upsetting and makes me not want to play if I have to be held hostage for 20+ minutes (since I would be punished for leaving) with people who are harassing me when it‚Äôs unranked and I am trying my best always‚Ä¶ 5 stars because it‚Äôs fun but only if you mute the chat completely and ignore the other players. Sad. However Legends of Runeterra and Ruined 
King are great though! Highly recommend those
review_title: People on this game are so mean!

review:
Hi all,

To start off I just want to say this game is the most laggiest game ever. My computers and PS5 runs at an incredible speed. I played other moba like MLBB and I had better experience with their server than this. Truth is that this game doesn‚Äôt care at all. I played many MOBA and this game punishes players the least. I get players who afk, intentionally feed and play roles that is already filled. No players gets banned for trolling and throwing games and worse part is their matchmaking is absolutely horrible. I would get players who don‚Äôt even know how to jungle, do baron lane or do dragon lane. These players would just stay in one position the whole game and don‚Äôt even help teammates with ambush or support. It is LITERALLY THE WORSE MOBA I have ever played. I played league on PC and I had wonderful experience but this isn‚Äôt it. The developers don‚Äôt fix server don‚Äôt ban troll players and have role queue which is the worse thing in the whole game. I don‚Äôt understand how I can be a support with 7 Kill per game, highest torrent and hero damage. This game makes literally no sense and it‚Äôs really bad. Please turn away

review:
League of Legends: Wild Rift is a mobile adaptation of the PC League of Legends. Wild Rift is a relatively accurate representation of the Summoners Rift which many of us have come to know and love. This game is literally packed with potential for breaking the mobile MOBA competitive scene into mainstream, here‚Äôs my current pros and cons.

PROS:
1. Accurate representation of League of Legends.

2. Faster gameplay for those not wanting to sink too much of your time into a single game.

3. Beautiful visuals, better than the PC version in my opinion.

4. Ranked system is much more fair compared to PC version, less likely to get hard stuck in divisions you don‚Äôt belong in.

5. Unique Wild Rift items, many of the new items Wild Rift introduced are brilliant and should be in the PC version.

CONS:

1. Lack of champion pool, this is only a current issue and will be worked on in due time.

2. Unbalanced characters, suffers from the same issue as PC League of Legends where some characters are a bit overpowered and others seem to be entirely forgotten about.

3. Lack of draft mode in normals.... Anyone who dislikes blind pick basically has no choice but to play ranked.

Overall I give this adaptation a 4 of 5 stars for being such a strong MOBA experience despite it‚Äôs current beta stage. Some small tweaks in needed places will give the extra needed boost to be a 5 star mobile title.

This game is super fun and gets my heart pumping. It‚Äôs like a real sport. However it is a team game and it is super frustrating to play ranked solo because of bad teammates. I‚Äôve been playing this game on and off for 5+ years on computer and now mobile. Unfortunately for Riot they have not found the balance between rewarding good players and punishing bad ones. Just today I‚Äôve been playing for six hours straight and have not moved up more than two mark points. I‚Äôve been saved over and over again by my mark loss points thankfully! But it‚Äôs so frustrating to grind all day and play really well to get nowhere! I‚Äôve gotten 8 SVPs and have been placed on awful teams that have barely made it to platinum before. I‚Äôve been up in diamond and honestly should be back there now. However it‚Äôs hard to move up when it‚Äôs an afk then a newbie who really cannot play well. Or players who have zero game IQ. Riot needs to at least make the SVP reward higher and not give them a mark loss in solo que. Please! Until then it‚Äôs not worth my emotion health playing this game for little to no reward.

There are some issues but I feel like this a why development exists.. A lot of talented people work for Riot and I'd bet money they'll iron out a lot of the small stuff.  (Examples : making support roles work better, dodging skill shots is quite a bit harder because of touch controls etc.)  The standard problem of mobile exists in that this isn't a game where you'll instantly know what to do and because it's free and basically everyone has a device people who have no idea how to play sometimes join ranked games and screw everything up.  That's a price of widespread adoption on mobile platforms where the solution  is to find friends to play with.. I don't think it's fair to blame the developers for that.  Overall this is the best we've ever had on mobile. 120 FPS on iPad Pro is pretty great.
review_title: Has a few issues but far and away the best on mobile.

review: This is coming from a person who supports riot from the start. I have been playing lol from beta, and switched to wild rift completely 2 years ago. Recently MMR became unbearable in the game. I understand that portion of it is dueto bad luck or bad day. However in my last 20 matches, I have been SVP or MVP in 18, and managed to lose 16 games. The root cause is algorithm that Riot uses to queue you with toxic players. You cant tell me that a person of sane mind can die 10 times in first 5 mins of the game while being in grand master/master tier. Which is happening every single game. This is either win trading or extremely toxic people who should be banned/flagged. This can easily be fixed by increasing punishment for bad behavior, or queueing toxic people with toxic people. I guess they bring as much money to Riot as others, so they try to integrate them with the community. After almost 3000 games, and decent money spent to support the development, I have finally decided to quit wild rift. Until issue called out by majority of the gaming community is fixed I wont be coming back.
review_title: It was good while it lasted

review:
I had played league for years before I called it quits. Then, I decided to start playing mobile knockoffs and got hooked on the genre again, so when wild rift was announced, obviously I was excited.
However, this game is a flaming pile of trash. Combine all the things you hate about every MOBA, and somehow they incorporated it all. We‚Äôre talking unbalanced matchmaking, blatant account boosting, a report system that does nothing, an atrocious targeting system, zero attempts at champion balances, and an overall game that just isn‚Äôt fun. Even in high plat elo (because I wanted to give it a chance) I still seem to get teammates who don‚Äôt understand the game at a bronze level on a true League elo basis, but the enemy team can macro like true gold-diamond.
At the end of the day, play league, or if you don‚Äôt have a pc, Arena of Valor of MLBB are both far better alternatives. Wild Rift has way too much wrong with it to even be considered an acceptable choice. In the true, Riot fashion they are busy releasing skins rather than fixing their game, so don‚Äôt get your hopes up that they‚Äôll polish the game any time soon.

review: The thing i like about this game are the basics of a MOBA. Controls, graphics, User interface, and network connectivity are all great however the matchmaking and community of this game make all this game‚Äôs hard work go to waste. To make this game one of the best of all time would be simple. Just fix how matchmaking works and it‚Äôll be top 10 for sure. Good players get paired up with good players, and bad players with bad players. No need for a balanced team because the good players get really discouraged from grinding rank when they get constantly afk‚Äôs or even bad teammates who purposefully try to loose games because of their bad experience. I‚Äôd say a really simple solution to this problem is match players based on hero mastery instead of rank or anything else. So if i have 6k or 7k mastery on a champ and im pre-choosing that champ before matchmaking i should be matchmaking with other 6k-7k champs enemies and teamates included. Just an idea.
review_title: Great game but has potential to be top 10 all time

review:
The last time I played LoL was S9 on the PC. It‚Äôs been a while since I‚Äôve played, but getting into Wild Rift was EASY! 
I can‚Äôt believe how smooth the creators made this game. Everything operates fairly easily on the MOBA, and better yet things were simplified further to give a different yet same feel‚Äîtake for example; Summoners Rift in comparison to Wild Rift map differ in their size, with the former being the larger map. 
The only real gripe I have with the game is the ping in-game. The server traffic get‚Äôs SO busy often, to the point where players would D/C or even AFK. 
Everything about Wild Rift is amazing‚Äî the same yet different game. If this server connection thing was improved, it would be solid. Most MOBAs suffer from this connection thing, so I don‚Äôt blame the creators. 
I pray and hope Wild Rift doesn‚Äôt die off because of this üôè‚Ä¶.. I spent too much üòÇ

The game overall feels very similar to it's main PC counterpart, however, they did take liberties to change the game for mobile. 

That being said, if you are coming to this from LoL like I am, you may have to adjust to using a touch screen to direct every movement, spell, and auto attack. If you also use unlocked camera often on PC, WR only has locked camera with a mini map you can 'check' on. 

The controls feel responsive. (with a good internet connection) Some spells have added range and effects to emphasize what they do. Minions will tell you they can be executed at a certain health threshold. All the champions I've played or played against feel balanced and effective for what they do. There's also a lot of communication pings. Perhaps too much.

The summoners rift ping lady screams. A lot. In addition, you have the power to spam her voice. I do not use this power gently, and never hesitate to spam ping "RE-RE-RETREAT!" to someone that cannot understand I called "Baron Lane." 

Which brings me to my biggest complaint, a lack of verbal acknowledgment from teammates in PVP or even Ranked. Too often I have queued calling a roll, and after locking in my champion would a random teammate hijack the lane playing whoever. I get that it's just mobile, but do you have to play Teemo every time?

Overall good game 4/5 mushrooms. I need an ibuprofen.

This game is everything a moba player wants in a game. Classic characters, Polished gameplay, Competitive Matches and I great community.  I‚Äôve been playing MOBAs for years. Games like Smite, Dota, League of Legends Pc and Heroes of the Storm. The game controls could use some tweaking but other then that it‚Äôs perfect. I‚Äôve been waiting for a great MOBA mobile experience for a long time and the only games that ever came close was VainGlory and Arena of Valor. I‚Äôm not mentioning Mobile Legends because it has stolen a lot from League and yes AOV has too but it‚Äôs owed by the same company. No disrespect to the people who play Mobile Legends.. but this is the real deal. This is the only MOBA I need on my phone and the only thing that could come close to stealing my heart is a Smite Mobile version and sadly that will probably never happen. Overall I am very happy with Wild Rift and I can‚Äôt not wait to see what the future holds.

They did well in capturing League on mobile but their reporting systems is lacks proper response or consistency.  They take no action on players who purposefully feed in the game which makes the playing experience terrible. I‚Äôve personally reported more than a few handfuls and Riot has no response but only to those who disconnect. That takes no effort on their part to find those disconnected, but to see a game and punish players who ruin it for everyone else, it‚Äôs too much work apparently. I‚Äôve come across dozens of players on this platform who all say the same thing and it makes ranked games unfavorable knowing that if someone feeds on purpose nothing will happen to them. I‚Äôve also had a few games where in ‚Äúall-chat‚Äù racial slurs are used but again Riot has no response if you report it. 
I‚Äôve tried reaching them to no success. They won‚Äôt respond but I‚Äôm sure a review will get a shallow corporate response. Nice job.

Out of curiosity, I decided to scroll through the critical reviews. None of them are an over exaggeration. All of the problems people are listing are VERY true and common in every single game. But what does the developer, Riot, do? Respond a generic response to almost every person asking them to fill out some ticket to complain to their website. They don‚Äôt fix any of these problems, they aren‚Äôt even reading what we are saying. I understand at the end of the day, Riot is making money. However, if they continue to ignore their community handing out actual helpful solutions to every problem of theirs, they WILL lose their community. Maybe not today, but a person can only devote so many hours to a video game that doesn‚Äôt devote an ounce of effort back. It‚Äôs a shame because this game can be really enjoyable when a team is full of competent players, whether we win or lose, at least we try. But the players who go afk, d/c, troll, intentionally die, harass, smurf, etc make it REALLY hard to enjoy what should be a good time.
review_title: Poor company running what could be a good game

review:
I can understand going AFK or closing the app to be a punishable offense; however disconnecting due to network issues in rural areas is less understandable. I‚Äôve been dropped from the game two or three times because my signal while traveling to or from town, I live in the middle of nowhere and this doesn‚Äôt happen every time it depends on multiple factors, and when the app starts working again I am banned from matchmaking for X amount of time.  

The game is great and I really enjoy it, even if I am pretty trash, I play as much as I can and apart from a gripe someone else already mentioned about nothing transferring between pc and mobile I have no other issues with the gameplay or anything else. The Game runs amazingly 99% of the time and apart from the issues I mentioned above I have zero gripe with it in its current form.

This game needs bans desperately, at least in ranked draft. I can‚Äôt put into how unenjoyable it is to have a master yi in every single game. They also changed how a few of the champions play in this version for some reason and don‚Äôt offer a refund on a champion that you buy planning to use only to find out they changed how some abilities work. Like Lee Sin, I‚Äôve always been a fan of using him as a support only to realize they changed his W in this. I spent $10 to buy him and now I‚Äôm stuck with a champ I‚Äôll never use as a support main. Things out of Riots control though are the fact that the player base with this actually has found a way to get more unintelligent than the PC version. People just run around not really paying attention to team comps or how to actually play league and if you‚Äôre familiar with league and know how to play it‚Äôs extremely frustrating feeling like you‚Äôre a ringleader with a bunch of literal monkeys.

After several months playing give up this game finally. Still remembered the time when I played LOL on pc when I was a kid.  Now this game gave me so bad experience. Hard to control on mobile. Also found some cheater and map hacker but the report system is just a joke.  The most important of all the worst matching system, especially for solo rank, cannot find a good teammate.  A lot of non English speaker in a chat make it worse. I am pretty sure I selected English but why team up me with non English speakers so many times. No cooperation at all.  Dragon owes the game. Get all dragons will win most of the time, thus with bad teammate is so hard to carry.  Some champions are OP, Darius for example if is fed earlier by bad teammate on solo lane, the game is over. It‚Äôs bad design to force to select the role.  I have to select to support always because no one wants support in solo rank.  I had horrible experience in this game.  Finally decide to give up and delete this game. Lucky I didn‚Äôt spend money on it earlier. Was hesitate to do so when my rank reached to emerald.  Anyway, Bye LOL.
developerResponse: {'id': 25204604, 'body': "Hi poplpuoy,\n\nThat sounds like something we might be able to help you with! Send us a ticket at https://support-wildrift.riotgames.com/ and we'll try to get you back on track.", 'modified': '2021-09-20T10:24:16Z'}

review: I really want to like Wild Rift. It‚Äôs a really good and faithful adaptation of the original PC version of League, it‚Äôs easy to pick up and some aspects of the game are streamlined for simplicity and mobile gameplay. However, the biggest issue with the game, or at least in my case, is the fact that the game just likes to not let you connect to matches sometimes. You get through Champion Select, so you know you‚Äôre already technically in game, but the second it moves over to the loading screen; ‚ÄúFailed to connect to match. Cancel or Reconnect?‚Äù But then Reconnecting doesn‚Äôt do anything, same pop up box appears. Cancelling signs you out and on sign in, tries to connect you to the same game again, and force closing app, changing Internet, repairing game build, all do nothing to help. I want to like this game, but until this issue gets resolved it‚Äôs only going to cause more problems, especially as it happens in ranked as well.
review_title: I want to like this game

review: Your server issues are just unbearable. I can not connect through WiFi or data and you slap me with a warning about leaving the game??? Your app can‚Äôt even load the game! And don‚Äôt get me started on match making issues. You can‚Äôt honestly tell me it‚Äôs ok to set up all these new people with people who have played the game for years and expect them to have fun. I have someone who has no regard for the games strategy every match. At least one person on every match doesn‚Äôt go to their respective lane, can‚Äôt jungle or just runs it down. Thirdly, I want all my skins. It doesn‚Äôt make sense that I have to pay for all the skins again. I won‚Äôt. And a lot of other people won‚Äôt when I can just play pc. You already have exclusive skins for WR so why do you need to lock all the existing skins when people already own them. At least people on pc will know how to play the game. You don‚Äôt just launch them into games with experienced players. It‚Äôs just not fun trying to to even get into the game. It‚Äôs not worth the leaver buster.
review_title: Sure this game is pretty BUT
developerResponse: {'id': 22059659, 'body': "Nothing can ruin a game like connection issues, and we'd like to help. Please submit a ticket on https://support-wildrift.riotgames.com/ and we'll see if we can't figure this one out.", 'modified': '2021-04-05T23:59:39Z'}

review:
Originally I loved playing Wild Rift when they were still bringing in newer characters, and the champions could be bought with the blue crystals you earn in game. As on the PC, the older ones cost less, and the newer ones cost more. It was just a matter of waiting and playing to earn.

First, they took away any kind of system where older ones cost less, and brought them all up to the same price of blue crystals. Now, if that wasn‚Äôt bad enough, ALL champions require additional currency that you MUST PAY FOR to own that champion. Step by step it‚Äôs becoming not just a pay to win, but a pay to play. It only gets more than one star because it still mostly plays like it used to.

I doubt I‚Äôll be playing it again unless some changes are made.
review_title: Was great, but now I could not be more disappointed

review:
While the game itself is fun and fluid. The players you get matched with are EXTREMELY unbalanced. To some it‚Äôs they‚Äôre matched with way too skilled players. Or in my case, matched with players that usually play like an ape. The ‚Äúthis player plays above his rank‚Äù is just an early indicator he has no idea what he‚Äôs doing. It‚Äôs infuriating to not play with players your actual skill level or rank. (I‚Äôm Masters) I‚Äôm tired of seeing emeralds in my game. The skill gap is way too big. Please I‚Äôll settle for longer queue time if it means getting matched with players MY rank. Not an entire 7 tiers below me. Ranked matchmaking is a joke of a state at the moment.

update sep 2022: matchmaking is ‚Äúbetter‚Äù but only the slightest and I only think it‚Äôs because the population is maturing, skill difference is still a massive problem. Playing normals with 3-4 friends can take up to 20-30 minute queue times. Overall please fix matchmaking, I played 3 games in 4 hours‚Ä¶.. mostly waiting. So frustrated I only played an aram‚Ä¶.
review_title: Ranked Matchmaking need a hotfix asap

review: this is by far one of the worst updates this game has ever had. for starters, you absolutely butchered the concept of runes. you added some of the most broken runes along w items to go w them and for that reason alone, it‚Äôs brought down to 3 stars. another issue that i constantly see is solo laners as a supp. in other mobas i‚Äôve played, there is sometimes a concept that does allow a player to choose any champ for any lane, which some people disagree w, but when you see nothing but dual adc or aatrox/pyke in ranked matches, you start to slowly lose interest in trying to figure out a way to counter. according to most social media posts, there are many that share my opinion that you are quite literally ruining the game  by trying to make it a different game rather than mobile league, which is what WE ALL WANT. but if your goal isn‚Äôt to make a mobile league but instead a sub branch from the main game, then the problems i listed should be nothing short of an easy fix for the devs/balance team, no?
review_title: worst update since the game came out

review: I‚Äôve been a long time league player and I might actually like this app more than the game itself. There‚Äôs a lot of depth, even in a simplified version of the game like this app, but it just feels like everything makes sense in this format. It‚Äôs fluid and plays faster than the average 45 minute League games, and is really satisfying. Controls are intuitive, and where I‚Äôve always had issues using a touch screen as a joystick for movement this one is easy to use and moves according to wherever you‚Äôre touching the screen. The only actual complaint I have is that I do wish that we had the ability to use skins we‚Äôve already bought in league‚ÄîI‚Äôm already linking my account so why should I need to pay for a skin I‚Äôve already bought? Besides that, love everything!

Riot,

You lack a sense of morals when it comes to games. The fairness of a game is if there is anyone who messes with the game negatively or goes afk which happens a lot people who try and are good get hindered. I have never experienced such a negative group of people when playing this game. Most were Spanish speakers who just play to be idiots. Platinum rank is toxic as all and riot loves to keep people there and team them up with bad players who get through the easyness of gold. They need to fix the issue of matchmaking and other key essential aspects to the main game   If you want people to play your game you need to have a reason for them to continue wanting to play the game. I was so excited to play this game due to feeling the lackluster of other MOBA‚Äôs on IOS. I really though riot would put thought into making this game but it is sadly just a cash grab for skins and stupid in game stuff that doesnt help you. I hate this game and will not be coming back unless riot focuses solely on the toxic environment in ranked. ‚úåüèª
review_title: Wow read this; riot please fix your game im done playing

review:
As a Chinese, I‚Äôm getting used of Victory. Wild Rift brings me more joy, but I have to point out that this version is a copy of LOL on PC laptop. It just reset few heroes and CD. First, a game could last 30 min or longer. It‚Äôs common for a game on PC, but remember, this is a mobile game. Second, store in game(not charge, I mean the store when you‚Äôre playing game, buy ‚Äúweapon‚Äù) isn‚Äôt clear enough. The style is the same as PC, I‚Äôm using iPhone XR, I can‚Äôt see the introduction cleanly even I have a good eyesight and it‚Äôs just too complicated!!! I am new to LOL, so it‚Äôs hard for me to choose the suited ‚Äúweapon‚Äù. So as I say, it‚Äôs not A PURE MOBA! Hope the RIOT can see this feedback!!!
Finally I need to point out is I am a Chinese and I am not living in English country and I have never been to any English country, so it‚Äôs common for me to use some old expressions and make some grammatical mistakes. So please ignore those mistakes, I promise you can understand what I mean
review_title: This is not a pure MOBA

review: As stated in the title, this is League of legends WILD RIFT - not just league of legends. Does it have everything from league on PC? No. Long story short - I am FULLY having an amazing time playing this mobile adaptation of league of legends. Compared to bang bang and other moba games - this one feels familiar and can spend a plethora of hours playing this! Every update has been interesting and improvement in the overall game. New champions, improved runes, skins, etc. THINGS I would like to see would be more pings to help out in certain in game situations. I would also like to see an overall improvement in ranked matchmaking! Some players are so toxic and I can never get to platinum due to some players throwing the game! I appreciate this game for what it is and what it can be! Let‚Äôs just not get vanguard involved please!

I think that the rank system can feel terrible sometimes mostly when you win a game and then lose a game wasting 40 minutes of your time getting no where meaning that you might as well never have queued up. A way they could maybe fix this is to rank you up based on a points system and your own performance since there‚Äôs already a feature to see what percentage of a certain champion you did better than after each ranked game. Another thing that can make ranked super annoying is that when teammates disconnect for THE ENTIRE GAME making it a 4v5, it still counts as a loss. A way to fix this is to have that game not count as a loss while the winning team has it still count as a win but get no ranked fortitude from it. Other than that I love this game so much and I‚Äôll admit, very addicted to it. :)

F this game. Ultimate time wasting machine, ultimate find out how bad and selfish people really are app. Win or lose 100% depend on what matchmaking decided to shove in your face. F you riot games. 

You play rank, they match you with a guy who choose first steals your character and who can single-handedly kill 20+ people in a match and carry the enemy team to win. You have to be the punching bag until the match end. Then you think ok this gotta be the bottom it can‚Äôt be worse than this, so you play another match, only to find the exact same guy, who this time pick first again, punch you in the face again, and you again have no where to run except for being the punching bag for the exact same guy. Shouldn‚Äôt there be some measurements to at least not match us with a guy who has drastically higher skills, freaking twice? These games are so long, you be punching bag for an hour straight and you hate ever been born. You regret the time you lost on this meaningless mobile game and hate your life decisions Literally unplayable

I am giving a 5 star game a 1 star after the removal of all-chat. You clearly haven‚Äôt surveyed every player in the game about it being a good idea or not. There was an option to remove all-chat if a player doesn‚Äôt feel like listening to enemy player and that was the best system in my opinion. Besides, most of the toxicity comes from our teammates rather than the enemy‚Äôs. All-chat doesn‚Äôt give us bad experience to the game, removing COMPLETELY does though. Now, we are not able to taunt or have a fun conversation with the enemy team making us unable to identify whether or not they have a good personality. This game is really great in my opinion, with constant bug fixes, smooth gameplay and competitive matches. But after removal of all-chat, I can‚Äôt help but show my discomposure. If you are reading this, I really wish you to consider putting all-chat back.
P.S: I have been playing from the released of the game(contains baron event) to this day but nothing has made me more upset than removing all-chat.

review:
I have been playing LOL for a long time now on the PC and have always loved the play.  It has always been on the leading edge of play for me
The problem I keep seeing with this game is two fold. the first is the GARBAGE targeting system that has been implemented. I am about to make a kill on a champ and suddenly my targeting goes to another random champ with full health. I have no idea why and it makes no logical sense. I look in settings and there is no reason why.  I have to then try to ‚Äúdeselect‚Äù the champ that somehow got targeted and try to select the champ I should already have killed which may be too late already. 
The other problem is the limited number of items and opportunities to vary champs load out based on who my team is playing.  What is the reason for that besides frustration?
Overall fun game but very frustrating if you wanted this to look anything like the LOL pc version.

The game is bad! Well not bad, but it needs a lot of work. Mechanics are perfectly fine just needs some fine tuning, however the main problem is the matchmaking. Ive been playing this game for over 2 years on mobile and each season it never fails to place me in a match with people who have no clue what they're doing. Its so frustrating going 12-4, 8-4,6-3 and so on with S and A ratings just for you to lose because teammates will go 0-7 or have no fundamental knowledge of the game. This is all in ranked by the way, in ranked!! Ive made it to master, not quite the challenger but I am a very decent player. I know a lot of people are having the same frustrations I am so please work on this and Ill remove this comment and change the rating. If you really care about your users you should listen their opinions and really put an effort to making the game a more fun experience.

I‚Äôd played LOL since season 2. For me, it‚Äôs more than just a game. However, I become more and more busy as I grow older. Recently, I don‚Äôt even have enough time sitting in my room, playing a full rank match anymore. This game offers me a solution. Now I can really play League on my quick breaks. I didn‚Äôt expect it‚Äôs this close to the original game. I just enjoyed seeing the champs, the skins, the gameplay that I loved in League. Thank you for making the game accessible for me anytime, anywhere! About some improvements, I think the auto target is a noticeable issue. It often keeps targeting the far enemies, even though the close ones have low HP. I couldn‚Äôt even manually change the target. This makes my champ auto moves forward the target, and it‚Äôs really hard to control when I play an adc like Vayne.
review_title: I‚Äôd recently given up League of Legends

review: I am seriously blown away by how much fun I am having with this. I have tried pretty much every moba worth mentioning (mostly from peer pressure from friends) and I did not understand or enjoy any of them. I decided to give this one a try and I‚Äôm having so much fun with it. I think it might be the touch controls, or the fact that I can play it in bed..I‚Äôm not sure what it is but the gameplay its nice, touch controls are responsive, very good tutorial (which for a dummy like me, I really appreciate). It‚Äôs no pushy at all about the paid mechanics of the game. I have unlocked a few ‚Äúpaid‚Äù characters already just by doing challenges. I literally took time out of my day to say how much I hate mobas and how much I like this game so give it a try!
review_title: For someone who hates MOBAs...I freaking love this game

review: The game itself is pretty standard; 5 roles, 3 lanes and plenty of champions. However, Im not sure if people aren't aware its a game of teamwork but there are plenty of matches where your team will not help. Maybe the game wasn't clear on the rules, and the tutorial is optional which isn't smart for beginners not used to MOBA games. And for someone who loves competitive play (i.e ranked matches) its pretty annoying when your team can force a loss with little to no repercussions. The reporting system is weak at best, ive seen MOBAS give you a immediate action when it comes to reports especially in ranked matches (THIS IS NOT ONE OF THEM). The only note you get is they will look at your report.... and nothing beyond that, you cant even block players that troll or are offensive (also on other MOBAS). Overall the game is fine for casual play but not for someone looking for balanced competitive play.
review_title: Is this the best you can do League of Legends...??

review:
Hey Riot, this is a beautiful game that looks amazing and honestly makes me wish so many more things were in the PC version (the version that I actively play) but the only thing that‚Äôs lacking here is control the support.

On PC if you truly wanted to play with a controller (which I do not recommend) you can end up remapping a keyboard to a controller so that way the controller activates and acts as a keyboard for the purpose of playing the game but there is no way to do anything of the nature and this game almost seemed as if it is meant to be played on a large device so people with smaller phones even if they are powerful enough to run it (I have an iPhone 11 Pro) are going to be a disadvantage because their hands are gonna block the majority of the screen and the screen is such an important part of the game.

As a long time League of Legends player, I was excited to hear that there was going to be a mobile version of the game. I downloaded it and noticed that it was missing some components from the pc version but that didn‚Äôt matter to me as much because the game was fun to play on the go. Only problem I have with it was that sometimes it wouldn‚Äôt let me load into match and said that there was a connection error. Clicking the retry option wouldn‚Äôt work either and whenever I‚Äôd try to cancel it would log me out of my account. After logging back in it would also ask the same prompt and the same situation as before would happen. I don‚Äôt want to be banned or reported for ‚Äúleaving‚Äù a match that I never connected to.

In fact, it is a failed game in terms of everything, only the match because it depends on the player. It is a failure in several respects, including that I have fast internet and it does not disconnect. When I search for a match, the game disconnects and the L sign appears in the middle of the screen and takes me to the main screen. I counted several times until I reached 5 minutes, despite everything being excellent. The second problem is that he waited for 15 minutes, and sometimes for 30 minutes, literally, always, and he brought me back to the main screen, and he brought me back and was late in searching. I attended for 10 minutes, deleted the game because of its failure, and I am a fan of it, literally addicted and a game that I adore, but the failed participants and those responsible for these problems fail, and in the game they throw me out, and that is because they claim that my internet is weak despite everything is excellent. problems
review_title: Solve these problems in the game

review: Ranked in this game is currently banless, but that‚Äôs to be expected without a huge champ pool. Now, when someone dodges, you‚Äôre locked out of being able to queue up for a game for about 5-10min, (even when you aren‚Äôt the one to dodge) due to the game trying to load and not being able to (not due to leaver penalties). The gameplay itself is a nice change from normal LoL, and the itemization is a little interesting. All in all, the game is streamlined, and the things that you would imagine are broken when the game is streamlined to this degree are indeed broken. I couldn‚Äôt be happier experiencing this small Indie developer‚Äôs 200 years of game design experience on the go. So far, the progression rewards are infinitely superior to standard LoL, and the lobby/customizations are aesthetically pleasing and enjoyable. If you have to leave, you‚Äôre replaced with a bot. It‚Äôs at about a low silver level.

It‚Äôs a really good game it‚Äôs better than I imagined I thought it was going to be a pretty good game I thought was going to be 4Stars but no it was5Stars I really enjoyed it you got to play against lots of players and it‚Äôs really fun and I like the characters answer abilities and I like how are you can play the game but anyways the best game in the world he isn‚Äôt the best game in the world but it is really good so that‚Äôs why I appreciate it if you like fighting people this is the game for you but anyways please keep on making more updates and more characters I love how do you made the gameYou putLots ofEffort but anyways I love your game so please make more characters andGame modes I love your Games you should make more I love your games but anyways I‚Äôll see you later when you make aShooter game you should copy Fortnite

The game and graphics are great! Making the character's animations in the match and looking at character skins gives it a whole new color. However, I wish all the characters were out as the PC version. I got temporarily banned on PC LoL for not knowing how to jungle correctly. I stopped playing for quite a while until this showed up. I like how you don't need to look at chat every time you play. When I looked at PC's chat, it was always toxicity from players, and sometimes it was directed towards me. I'm bipolar, and I get depressed when people are rude to me. Also, another good reason is that I can play LoL better on mobile. I don't understand, and it's weird but also relieving. Anyway, enough of my rambling! I'll give this game 10/10, but I wish I could play Ekko soon...

IVE been playing for about half a year and this is the only thing I HATEEEE. The game functions great, yes sometimes the new characters out do attacks etc but thats also an advantage. During rank up matches why are lvl 12s getting recruited with lvl 50s and 100s so on? Im lvl 34 but I WAS already emerald 4 about to hit 3 because I grind so hard but I get stuck with ‚Äúnoobs‚Äù. I have 10 straight losses which got me demoted to platinum because I havent gotten recruited with any higher ranks. The reason this is a problem is because every noob player is picking characters that dont even correspond to their lane so we dont have tanks, healers etc just a team full of gun characters against a full on blown tank team. Two other complaints I have is it takes wayyyy to long to even get a character Ive counted it takes about two weeks even you login everyday. To get skins which I rarely have any, you need money so you‚Äôre stuck with old skins.

Figure it out Riot. It isn‚Äôt that hard. Stop putting diamond players on teams with bronze, silver and gold in ranked. Whatever stupid formula you are using for their Mrr or whatever you call it is obviously flawed. I‚Äôve been a huge fan for a decade and I‚Äôm about done. If you think someone is a smurf fine. Put them with other smurfs of their same rank. That way if you are wrong at least you aren‚Äôt messing up your dedicated players! I don‚Äôt even want to think about how much of my money I‚Äôve spent on your games over the years. You are ruining the experience for your players. There are a lot of other games out there. I can easily choose another to spend my money on.

The game legit just gets worse. Diamond is just filled with 2.0 kda players. It is so hard to rank up because of all the players the system has artificially boosted. Riot only cares about making money not about the quality of their game. So keep terrible players happy by boosting them as long as they play enough.

review: Love the game it‚Äôs freaking fun I‚Äôve never played on pc version but love this game. Now I wish there was like a pregnancy setting so when I miss out on accepting I don‚Äôt have a waiting period my wife is preg and sometimes she has cramps no game in the world is worth her hurting so I stop and make sure to take care of her I get it‚Äôs annoying when people just randomly leave or are doing something else and miss out but I‚Äôd rather take care of her instead of playing. I have played this game for a really long time. It seems like the game would pair you up with poor teammate for several games after you have a 2or3 wins in a roll. It‚Äôs weird cuz it sometimes even pair with you some AIs, which never speak out and never collaborate with teammates. 
I mean it‚Äôs normal for game designer that builds up this kinda things to make gamer addicted to the game. But, it just looks way too obvious for this game‚Ä¶. To me, I felt like this company loses some original enthusiasm when making this game. If you play A LOT, you‚Äôll have a good winning rate. You‚Äôll be paired with normal people. This is how this game works cuz they want you to play A LOT. But if you just play like two rounds per one or two days, you‚Äôll have pretty bad winning rate not because you‚Äôre bad at this game, but the system would pair you with AIs who are not even collaborating at all. Delete this game‚Ä¶. It‚Äôs controlling you‚Ä¶. (Btw try spending more dollars on this game‚Ä¶.not sure if it helps on winning rate(?

It‚Äôs fun for a mobile version of Lol, but you will run into some problems. Firstly, I play on the NA servers, but what you‚Äôre going to run into is majority of your team speaks a different language, and 9 times out of 10, what they say is going to be something negative or hateful. It‚Äôs frustrating to try and communicate with your teammates when they speak another language. Secondly, with it being a mobile game, a lot of times even in ranked, players don‚Äôt play the game how it‚Äôs supposed to be played. Ex. I play mid lane and had to deal with a mundo and ahri in the mid lane. It makes any kind of actually gameplay frustrating and aggravating. I‚Äôm sure I could nitpick more, but those seem to be the two biggest issues besides people going afk. Otherwise, if you can look past the faults, it‚Äôs a decent little time killer.

Of course like most of us that have left a review, we came from playing LoL on PC. But I have to say, for being a mobile version of the game it is well made! I am running this game on a iPhone 13 pro, so of course it‚Äôs going to run great. I have not read much about running this game on another model of iphones but I can only assume adjusting some of the settings it will still be an overall great experience. You can NEVER expect it to be the same as the PC version but I used to play this game on a MacBook and it still was a great experience. So for all you mobile users looking for a new experience of gaming on the go, this one has to be my favorite yet! Leave the BR‚Äôs for console or PC right now, and enjoy this masterpiece. ;) brings good memories haha

I love this game it‚Äôs easier to learn and play than league on pc. Being able to set up multiple item sets on a character is great and the tutorial helped me figure out how to actually play league. Another good thing about this game that‚Äôs better than regular league is choosing a preferred position and if you don‚Äôt get it for two games then they put you in it so you know that at least 1/3 matches are your favored position. 
The only bad thing I have to say about this game is the casual match making I‚Äôm an iron 4 the lowest rank my best is probably bronze or silver but in casual match making if you have a really good game they start pairing you with the top level players. At that point for me the game is not fun to play cause i at least don‚Äôt have the skill level for higher play than bronze and silver.

The amount of free champions and skins that you get just though playing is nuts. Just from early progression alone you end up with a great deal of options and there are plenty of ways to earn in-game currency to get more. No ads, no in-your-face money sinks. Just a good game that speaks for itself. Looking forward to more favorites to be added in the future (Morgana soon?). 

Compared to the PC game, the shorter game length and slightly compacted map are very appealing - yet it still faithfully translates the experience. 

Only complaint is that the in-game UI is fairly crowded. I thought it would be meaningfully better on the iPad version but did not find that to be the case. It would be nice to have some customizations options for the UI like scaling, button location, and opacity.
review_title: F2P done right, replaces the PC version for me.

review:
I love this game. I really do. But the bad ping has to stop. When I first downloaded the game, everything was fine. No lag or delay or bad ping. But after the recent update to the game, I have been receiving bad ping and a lot of lag. I can‚Äôt play one game without it lagging and delaying. I have everything on the lowest settings available in the game and I still have lag and delay. And my device is new so I know it is not that. I don‚Äôt know what the issue is, but please fix it. I like this game and would not have given it one star had this issue not happened. But it did. When it is fixed, I‚Äôll change my review. Until then, one star. But at least tell me what the issue is so I can fix it and continue playing the game. 

Edit: I updated the game and its new ‚Äúfix‚Äù for lag spikes it did absolutely nothing to fix it. I‚Äôm still getting huge ping spikes. There is no reason why I should be going from 36ms to 999ms in the blink of an eye. Pls fix. I REALLY want to continue playing this game.

review:
5/5: My experience is the mobile version is much better than the PC version for several reasons. I enjoyed playing it much more than I expected.

First, moving champions on a touch screen actually making the action of moving more accurate and smooth. It‚Äôs easier to have to keep clicking my mouse very quickly to move them around on pc.

Second, I like the faster pace of the game. Each game could run as fast as 10 minutes, and a long game doesn‚Äôt go over 30 minutes because of its simplified map (but the game is as fun). I remember I used to have some 50+ minutes game when I played it on PC and it was very tiring.

Third, I like the variety of events it has. It updates it‚Äôs events frequently and it has fun and useful rewards.

Last but not least, kind of related to my first point, when a champion is moving on the screen, the screen automatically move with it so my champion is always at the center of the screen. This is a life saver as I don‚Äôt have to drag my mouse to move my screen around like what I did on the pc version.

Overall, it‚Äôs a successful app and you should try it if you haven‚Äôt.
review_title: Better than the PC version (my opinion)

review: I was going to write an entire review, but it got wiped, so i‚Äôll just summarize it. This game is a waste of time. The devs don‚Äôt care about you, the producers/publishers don‚Äôt care about you. The community doesn‚Äôt care about you (apart from a tiny minority). Worst tutorial i‚Äôve ever seen of a game with this much complexity. By FAR. It‚Äôs terrible. There are item synergies, character synergies, counters, specific play styles and game knowledge that is necessary to not be a liability. NON OF WHICH, is explained in game. Over 100 characters and 90% of the time i see the same 20 gimmick characters that again need specific play style and knowledge to counter. 10 year old game btw. I would never recommend this game to anyone who wants to invest time and money into something. Unless you like very well done animations and art, thats the only reason to play this crap and why i‚Äôm not giving it one star. 2/5 at best.
review_title: Don‚Äôt waste your time and money.

review:
Im new to games like this but i. Addicted the competition is amazing i love the characters and skins( i hope they add more). Tbh dont have much negative things to say. The game is amazing i wish it would be easier to find friends to play with like a world chat or something but it is really fun im super addicted. PLEASE ADD MORE CHAMPS WE WANT EM ALL!! Please dont let this game die i love it.
EDIT: ranked is unplayable the amount of losing streaks i get because of the worst braindead teammates i have is insane finally made it to diamond now being deranked back to emerald 3 because for some reason i get teammates that act like they have never played the game before FIX THE MATCHMAKING i dont understand why i get put on these huge insane losing streaks thinking about deleting this game until the matchmaking is fixed

Being league of legends I expected something that would stand out from the other mobas on mobile. This is honestly underwhelming. Having joystick controls on a platform were touch could work so much better is annoying. The only strategy that comes from this game is picking heroes otherwise the gameplay is lacking. Ever game feels the same. There doesn‚Äôt feel like there‚Äôs a challenging ever, playing other mobas around this one feels like the worst. In rank there‚Äôs no bans, if there‚Äôs an overpowered hero you better hope to get it otherwise you can‚Äôt stop them from doing so. Team fights are over in seconds and never feels like you can change the outcome. Having a team fight last 3 seconds is disappointing. Playing other mobas where it‚Äôs a struggle and you can actively buy items to counteract the enemy team feels better. This is just sad, the items aren‚Äôt confusing it‚Äôs just that the heroes decide the fights and matters none what you have
