review: I‚Äôm an experienced moba player on mobile apps and I‚Äôve played most of the existing popular moba games on the market. I‚Äôm very excited to know that the LOL came released on apple store few days ago and I‚Äôve been playing it these days. A duplication of the PC part as it is, it‚Äôs definitely more complicated when compared to other games. But I think the overall experience is perfect. One thing I do feel kind of in need for improvement is the control of performing basic attack, the manipulation is kind of weird and different from other existing games. When you are in a team war and you want to attack someone nearby, it sometimes does not react. And it looks not smooth when you move and do basic attack simultaneously. So it‚Äôll be really great if such issue can be optimized
review_title: Generally decent experience, with minor issues to improve

review: The penalization for afks should be fine tuned. If the repetitive offenders could have a 20 minute low priority queue, it would make a great deal of difference. The game works and feels amazing however the impact from teammates causes the game to lose its competitive feel, which is already uncommon for mobile games. What this game has going on for it is great, however, it should take into account that it is still a mobile game, and it will always be one. Making punishments reasonable / hard for one is definitely a difficult task, but not impossible. 20 minutes to wait for a *ranked* game should be the standard for the ones willing to leave their team behind because of something going on in their lives. It somewhat teaches accountability and ultimately responsibility.

This is exactly what a mobile version of LoL needed to be. The full fledged PC game exists as a fantastic 5v5 team based game with lots of depth. The mobile version exists as a faster paced, slightly dumbed down version of said game.

It‚Äôs great, matches can be quick and fun, taking a fraction of the time that desktop League would take. The controls are nice, and lend themselves to the versatile skills of the many characters, allowing you to quickly and easily cast character abilities, and not favoring a specific style of champion. 

I for one will not sit on my phone for 45+mins to play a match of League. This feels exactly perfect, sitting right in a sweet spot, where there‚Äôs just enough depth, to make the game challenging, while not prolonging gameplay past the point of annoyance, when using a mobile device!

I love this and I have loved League of Legends for a long time. I have wanted a mobile version of LOL for ever, but I hate the joystick controls. It makes the game feel like a bit clunky to me and harder to control than if I were on PC. Which negates the point of the minke version of it‚Äôs supposed to feel like it‚Äôs PC. There is a game Vainglory that uses tap style movements/abilities. It works really well for me and feels as fluid as PC. When I say tap I mean where you touch on screen is where you move/Auto attack. If you could make it so you could do the same with ability and movements I would love the game even more. I‚Äôm sorry to be a pain. And I know this is beta but I wonder if we will be able to sync our profiles in order to get skins we paid for already?
review_title: Make a tap style/tap to move and fight

review: I love this game, it‚Äôs amazingly well done and the graphics are beautiful. However I do have some minor changes that I would make to the game. For instance if you really only get to pick what champions you get in the start of the game when you know absolutely nothing. You have to pay money for other champions you want to get farther along in the game. You also really can‚Äôt get any nice skins without using money either, I know games like this need money to run, however I know people that start to lose interest in games where you play a few champions over and over again. Maybe if the devs would put more champion boxes in the (free) wildpass, they wouldn‚Äôt start to lose interest anymore. THANK YOU FOR READING!!

I downloaded this to play with my girlfriend while we talked on the phone. I could barely hear her talk due to the games pointless background music while it downloaded with no way to turn sound off. 

By the time it was finally done we were both a lot less excited, but both laughed about being happy to finally turn off sound!!

Nope‚Ä¶.. straight into forced tutorial mode. Even though we both have played league before. And another, and another.. tutorials and forced menu clicking with no way to adjust sound.

So enraging. 

It then tries to make me answer silly little questions I had to exit and engineer to select the champion I actually wanted. 

We are both not thrilled at this point.. but we were excited to play a game together in bot lane soon!

Nope‚Ä¶.. forcing us to play a game alone without eachother for 15 minutes, against bots, before I can play with them. Exiting out doesn‚Äôt work. No way to cancel this ignorant tutorial.

So so so so so disappointing. What started as fun and excited was completely ruined. The forced tutorial is absolutely horrendous. It zaps any bit of fun and excitement with invasive freedom sucking presence.

Just allow it to be turned off, make it obvious to turn it back on in case someone out there is actually so crippled mentally they require a series of arrows to find there way through champion selection.
review_title: Forced tutorial ruined the initial experience

review:
I have 1 problem to tell 1 advice and 1 proposal.
Problem: I‚Äôve seen a lot of people at the community who are complaining about some allies who should not be near that rank. Which means they are boosted who have high elo and low ranked skills (example he is diamond but plays like an iron).
And some matchmaking issues like there are people who are waaaay lower than the ranks they are playing with. I saw unranked playing with a diamond ranked in RANKED. 
Oh and one other thing can you work more on ability interactions? I will give u and example (if you stun lux when she is using ult. She will ult anyway :/) these kind of interactions.

Advice: add another option for controlling pls like VAINGLORY its controlls were waay easier and smoother than joystick type. In teamfights you could use what to do easier and faster u can do it like this too but touch control was waaay faster.

Proposal: can u stop randomly adding champs to wild rift? Ask the players what to add next. Its not like you are gonna make a new champ you are just adding them from LEAGUE OF LEGENDS with a few differences.
You can say ‚Äúwhat do you want to see next‚Äù and ask the players to choose champions from pc version of LOL.
That way players would be more satisfied and know that you pay attention to their needs. And hear their voice.
Every game has a lifespan pls don‚Äôt make this ones short by ignoring players ideas.

This game is amazing don‚Äôt get me wrong but the fact that when the game wants to just break and start an infinite loading screen when trying to choose your champion, it gets very annoying and I don‚Äôt have all day to wait for the loading screen to stop and pop up the ‚Äúreconnect/cancel buttons‚Äù; if you click ‚Äúreconnect‚Äù it loads forever, and if you click ‚Äúcancel‚Äù it kicks you out of your game and makes you sign back in, so I just know it‚Äôs not going to load back up and leave the game (it‚Äôs not just me either, it‚Äôs everyone in that same game, that their game crashes) so then I come back to the game only to get banned for doing nothing. It‚Äôs the game‚Äôs fault not mine that I left. Fix it please.

Have played this since season 2, always wish Riot to improve match making and punishment for griefing/inting behaviour, but Riot never listen, every new season is even worse than the previous one, more serious punishment like suspension from playing ranked games would definitely help, I might give the last chance to Riot n see how r thing going on in the upcoming season, otherwise definitely delete this game ans say bye bye to the patch 5.0, I have supported this game by playing n paying (top 100 collector in my server), hope you, Riot, really do something but not just focusing on those cosmetics, the match experience is your fundamental factor of being successful, not how many skins u made, more player join your game means more chance of selling more skin, u r just squeezing the buying power of current limited base of players, but u guys forget a thing, players like me starts to hate your game, you r encouraging supportive players to leave your game

review:
this MOBA is phenomenal when it to quality and mechanics, but the current ranked matchmaking system is abysmal. The entire goal of the algorithm in its current state is to keep you at a 50% win rate +/- 1%, which results in matches that have teams
composed of players with skills levels all over the spectrum. This generally results in extreme frustration for the higher skilled players being asked
to carry these low skilled teammates. The system could benefit from a change so that highly skilled
players are teamed up with the same and face off against a team of the same when playing ranked. Rather than the current system that only breeds frustration and discontent with how it currently functions.

Worst matching system ever. Do not play Mobile lol if you are a fun of lol. ELO matching system is broken, literally have more than two feeders on my team every game just because I am a gamer from pc server and I know how to play the game. I even met a player named ‚Äú Best feeder GG‚Äù and int for 0/14/0, but it seems he got no penalty for that even though I reported him. Again the matching system is the worst ever. Making you stay with all the players that have so much worse gaming abilities than you because you are good so that they can lower your win rate. I got SVP and MVP for most of my games. Even I am just at gold level right now I am matching those feeders in platinum gamers. I have no idea how those feeders can get to platinum when I checked their matching history and they got broken kda every game. It is not fair to destroy my game experience just because I know how to play the game. I have already deleted the game. For those gamers from pc server, DO NOT DOWNLOAD THIS GAME!!!!!

review: I barely ever leave reviews but I couldn‚Äôt ignore this. WILD RIFT IS COMPLETE GARBAGE, I promise you. Devs are more concerned w/ using the game as a tool of business in order to make money rather than providing players w/ a consistently smooth, enjoyable and balanced gaming experience. Point, blank, period. Short-term its similar to LoL PC which is cool and a nice option to be able to play but long-term, if you actually planned on investing a considerable amount of time & energy into this sub-par, bug infested, unadulterated lag spiking circus of a mobile game, you‚Äôre going to inevitably end up being very frustrated, disappointed and disgusted w/ the game, and the experience as a whole, more than once. My recommendation: if you just want a new MOBA to try out or want to play LoL on-the-go, then do as you wish and give this game a try‚Ä¶but by ALL MEANS‚Ä¶do yourself a favor and do NOT spend a single PENNY on this game or any minor/major financial or time investments as you will be sorely dissatisfied with your investment.

review:
Wild Rift is fun but ban is ridiculous. I didn‚Äôt even get into a match nor did I even log into game because of poor signal, but I‚Äôm suddenly banned for hours??! Frustrating when I want to play but ban doesn‚Äôt allow me. Ban should really only matter for ranked or have a smarter AI controlling it. 

I like that matches can be short because it is on a mobile platform, and can end quicker than PC with a win or a surrender. Only issue is with the ban policy because they give you a lot of free event things to help with gaining characters and certain perks such as skins and emotes. 

Overall game can be enjoyable without spending any money at all. There are connections issues/ errors that occur just be aware of signal drops. In game play can‚Äôt stand around at all or you will be deemed AFK even though you are in the shop at base searching through an item to buy.

So I absolutely love Wildrift so far and for the most part there is nothing wrong with the game. I've played a few moba's before and so I've been comparing it with those.

One thing I noticed though is that the character selection phase (right before the game starts) is GOD AWFUL. Although this flaw isn't enough to ruin the game, it is definitely something that needs some work. 

If you don't already know, when selecting what characters you and your teammates will play as, they're all sectioned off into their respective roles so that you'll know what your characters'role is. Sounds great right? Well there's just one small problem. UNLESS you are an experienced League of Legends player, and you know the role of every character, you will NOT know what role you teammates are playing. When teammates pick their character, you are not told their role unless that specific player says "I'll jungle" or something like that. 

This flaw makes the game very unfriendly to beginners because they aren't told what role is needed until all other teammates choose theirs. If this is fixed, it will make the game much better for new players who don't know all of the characters yet.

So I normally play league on my pc and wanted to give this version an honest shot and it‚Äôs great even go as far as to say fantastic but the one thing that needs to be looked at is the ban timer I normally never get this ban timer unless dogging a game to get a friend in the lobby so I‚Äôm upset at the fact that because my connection keeps getting interrupted and it won‚Äôt let me reconnect to the match mind u it‚Äôs a bot match not even norms I get punished by not being able to play the game for 20min please look into this an fix connection problem ban I know this is the NA test but if that keeps on being consistent I will stay on my pc and never come back to wild rift once this issue has been addressed I will give it the score I believe it deserves a 5/5 but till then it will remain a 3 for me for those of you able to connect and not have a problem enjoy your stay on the rift :)

Read the very low reviews. Almost every single 1, 2 or 3 star is written by a competitive computer LoL player and it‚Äôs obvious. They just need to touch some grass. The game is great and the players are generally way less mean than pc players. Controls are intuitive for anyone that has ever played a touch screen game and honestly if you wanted to play pc LoL this is the best way to start/ learn. 

The only reason I didn‚Äôt put 5 stars is because the matchmaking could be better. Having one top tier player on a team that can essentially solo the game in an unranked match is dumb. I‚Äôm like a low mid tier player and it‚Äôs obvious sometimes how big the skill gap is between 1 person and ALL 9 others. 

Matchmaking via stats is the way to go! If it was I‚Äôd give 5 stars!

Ok, if you want people to continue playing this version of LoL, ease up on the ban for AFK, especially in vs AI games. I have two children that aren‚Äôt always agreeable, and for that reason I tend to play more mobile games now a days. I was very excited to see a ‚Äúfull‚Äù version League of Legends come to mobile, and all in all my experience has been enjoyable. But sometimes, I have to set my phone down for 30sec to re-situate one of my kids. Do this enough times, and you get a ban that increases each time, and let me tell you, it doesn‚Äôt take much for the ban to kick in. Having to wait over an hour to re queue just makes me want to uninstall. I agree there should be some sort of punishment for leaving game/AFK, especially in PvP. But as far as vs AI is concerned, you need to adjust the parameters. It‚Äôs a bit too extreme in my opinion. End rant.

This game is amazing! Glad that Riot was able to make League of Leagends into a mobile version that is fast paced. It includes the ability to play with friends, meet and add new friends. It has an in-game voice chat and reporting system for offensive players, cheaters, and trolls. Boasts amazing artwork and graphics, wonderful music, and even better lore. All of the actual real world money spent on the game is either cosmetic or for champions. As you play the game, you earn ‚Äúblue motes‚Äù a free to play currency that anyone can use to buy champions. Matchmaking is based on an MMR system so that you do play against players of the same caliber. I can‚Äôt say enough about this game! Immerse yourself in Wild Rift and experience it in all of its glory!
review_title: League of Legends Wild Rift has it all!

review: While the graphics and characters are spot on with their desktop counterparts, the game play suffers from some hardcore oversimplification that makes it entirely too easy to get stomped by easy to play champs. Seems like every match has a Vayne and/or Yi who just runs rampant and ruins the experience for all the other players. Then there‚Äôs the leaver penalty - Riot needs to understand this is a MOBILE game, and sometimes people have to put their phone down. Granted if it becomes excessive it should be discouraged, but setting your phone down to deal with a real life issue should not be penalized by a 150 second matchmaking delay for PAYING CUSTOMERS. Extremely disappointing. That doesn‚Äôt make me want to avoid the matchmaking penalty, it just makes me want to avoid spending money on this app. If I had time to focus 100% on the game, I‚Äôd be playing the desktop version anyway.

The issue with the ranking system is that it allows for individuals to climb up fairly easy with barely any experience in the game. In comparison a person with 2000 games with the rank of Edmiral is matched up on the same team with someone who has 300 games. The disparity is, is the game knowledge for the person with 300 games. And that also reflects in a game experience. Individuals with 300 games are still not map aware and are still learning champions. The whole ranking system is broken to the point that is almost unplayable. We expect individuals to play their best. But yet play the worst they could ever play. AFK - I‚Äôm not sure if this is a connection issue or an issue with the end-user. But the make up is not as fluid as it should be. A person can play a game for 10 minutes and all of a sudden another player decides to go AFK. At that point the only thing you‚Äôre going to get out of Wild Rift is fortitude. And not a make up session.

There are a ton of bots showing up in lobbies. And you get penalized for leaving, but the bots don‚Äôt seem to disappear. Literally had 3 games in a row with bots on at least one team. 

Plus, the matchmaking needs a major overhaul. You‚Äôll matched game after game with people who afk/feed/don‚Äôt know their champs/steal your role and you‚Äôll be down 10+ kills in the first few minutes. That happening one or two games is fine, but there are times we‚Äôre I‚Äôll have a streak of five or more lobbies just like that. Makes you want to uninstall when you see that happening. 

Aside from that though. It‚Äôs a great game, and as someone like me who doesn‚Äôt have a computer, it‚Äôs a pretty great replacement for LoL (though I haven‚Äôt played in 5 years so take that with a grain of salt)

I‚Äôve played league on the pc for a few years now and was quite excited when i heard it was coming to mobile. I don‚Äôt have time to play on my pc nowadays. The game feels about as good as it can for a mobile game because obviously there‚Äôs limitations you have to work with, and that of course is understandable. It‚Äôs not gonna be perfect you know what I mean? The only real issue I‚Äôve had with the game since downloading is not being able to connect to my games occasionally. My WiFi works just fine, but as I‚Äôm loading into the game it attempts to reconnect to the server is unable to, even after restarting the game. Of course I understand the game is new so bugs and server issues need to be worked out. Simply wanted to address the issues I‚Äôve noticed. Keep up the great work!

This game is still in a work in progress but what games aren‚Äôt now a days. It is being constantly updated and improved. It seems with every release they are really thinking about what characters to add to make the game not as broken as other mobile Mobas. There are great opportunities to meet people and grow with each character depending on play style. Only thing I would recommend join this game or staying with it is make friends, don‚Äôt harass and have fun. There are a lot of people who just don‚Äôt care about others in any game. That being said it‚Äôs best to make friends and have a good time playing. Hope new players have as much fun in this game as I do!
review_title: Must try even if you don‚Äôt like these games.

review:
Many people are very confused with how patches work and the current state of the game.

When a new patch drops, not everything for that specific patch is released at once - it happens over a 1 - 2 month period, as there are sub patches that happen throughout the span of a major patch (Ex. Current patch is 2.4, sub patches will be 2.4a, 2.4b, 2.4c‚Ä¶)

Also, this game is still in BETA, there is and will be issues. The more people stress test the servers and help spot issues, the better and more stable the game will become. If you can‚Äôt accept that and help mold the future of the game, then this game is not for you and I wish you luck in finding a game that doesn‚Äôt make you spend hundreds for a skin or locks characters behind a paywall.

Started off buggy which is fine, it‚Äôs a new game and it happens but now I‚Äôm being kicked out of the server and being punished for something I can‚Äôt control. I can‚Äôt log back into the game until the match is over, before you didn‚Äôt get a penalty because the server kicked you out but now I have to wait almost and hour to play after being kicked out due to this bug that hasn‚Äôt been addressed. No penalties for people who trash talk, feed, and go afk but if you get kicked out due to a bug you get a punishment. Too worried about loading heroes and skins into the game to fix the bugs that make this game trash. Waited over a year for this to finally come out and I‚Äôm disappointed, super buggy, which is sad because everything else about this game is great but I‚Äôm ready to uninstall because I‚Äôm constantly being kicked out of a match during the loading screen and getting a punishment when I can‚Äôt log back in

Im a Master player and I acknowledge that Wild Rift has a very terrible matchmaking which is a waiting line to searching for players who has same level and skill to make up a team of 5 players. As my experience so far, I am always put into a very unfair matchmaking team where I have to carry a very heavy worst player who are not even in the same rank as me. AND IF they are same rank as me, they are mostly feeders because I always checks their history match of bad players after every game I finished. They always fed above 10 kills every match they played and I still don‚Äôt know how Wild Rift could put me, a very serious player who always brings to Wild Rift so many contributions to Wild Rift‚Äôs operation by always achieving every game KDA, getting MVP, finish the Everyday Mission, and ESPECIALLY THE ONE THAT SPEND THE MOST TIME OF MY LIFE TO CONTRIBUTE TO THIS GAME. YOU GUYS NEED TO FIX THIS ABNORMAL AND RIDICULOUS STATUS RIGHT NOW OR THERE WILL BE MORE AND MORE GOOD PLAYER LIKE ME GIVING UP ON THIS UNFAIR SITUATION.

You will constantly have to either carry your entire time because they‚Äôre all incompetent or refuse to choose roles based on everyone else, or they will just Instantly lock the champion they want to play regardless of skill level or anything, then just proceed to feed the enemy team over and over again. This game was fun for maybe an hour or two but the way match making is ruins it. Your team will make you lose then refuse to surrender, wasting 20-30 minutes of your time just letting the enemy team get stats and points. The devs don‚Äôt give a crap about fair play or punishing those who auto lock champions, you either have to just play support and pray your team isn‚Äôt missing chromosomes or just take the pain of losing over and over. The devs need to step up and actually maybe this game playable, instead of just catering to those who have a team or whatever it is. God awful developers

review: This game in general is very good I wish voice chat came back, the time I am here right now while I'm writing vc is disabled because of a known  issue. It's very enjoyable and fun and it's easy to get characters and try your best even when you lose you still get points I recommend being careful and rank other than that try not to be toxic and yeah I haven't met any toxic people so far on

I‚Äôve played every MOBA on the market and ever since League of Legends said it was coming to mobile I was excited. Every MOBA like Onmyoji Arena, Mobile Legends, and Vain Glory are good, but don‚Äôt give that same outplay feeling/potential. Yes I know Wild Rift does needs improvements but doesn‚Äôt every game? There‚Äôs nothing more that I love than hard working developers and Wild Rift definitely fills that. The MOBA listed and more feels like they have a vast difference in characters power and just isn‚Äôt unfair or entertaining. If you disagree with anything I just said play Wild Rift and see for urself they balance everything fairly and if not the first time they work on it quickly. It‚Äôs high quality I‚Äôm comparison to its competitors.

I played this for a few days, and I‚Äôve never played League of Legends before. I‚Äôve been a fan of some of the characters over the years, tho‚Ä¶and the new Netflix series is AMAZING‚Ä¶so I decided to give the game a try. Unfortunately, I think it‚Äôs garbage. I enjoy these style of games, but this one seem pointless. I probably played 30 rounds and almost every game I played, nobody understood what ‚Äúteamwork‚Äù means. You need support and have to give support to not only win the battle, but to also have an enjoyable time. People just leave you in battle and go off and attack things in different areas that aren‚Äôt even required for the event or battle. A few times I had some great teammates and we dominated as a team, but most the time that isn‚Äôt how it goes. It would be great if there was a solo play mode where you don‚Äôt have to depend on other people to step up and contribute. Great
concept, but doesn‚Äôt work in my opinion. Not fun üëé

review: After the big update, all the players rank in classic mode are scattered everywhere, you see I ranked, silver, gold, etc. riot should separate the ranking procedures and keep them on their ranks, it‚Äôs hard for players like me when after playing rank, I‚Äôd play normal full of people who doesn‚Äôt know what they‚Äôre doing, I know it‚Äôs not just me. This is most players but nobody has never said anything about it, it makes normal match looks like a clown city when the pros and beginners clash like they don‚Äôt know what they‚Äôre doing, my win rate dropped from 70%+ with over 500 matches to 50%+ just because of this mess that hasn‚Äôt been fix but hopefully you guys will fix it, I‚Äôve bought multiple skins and I love this game used up close to 400$ on this game but how can I keep supporting riot if they don‚Äôt want to change.

This is one of my favorite games buuut it‚Äôs hard to rank because if you are unfortunate enough to be placed on a team of farmers and trolls (who play for reasons unknown to me) you will lose your rank if your team loses, not because you had a bad game. It‚Äôs super frustrating and honestly it‚Äôs made me play less because you just feel no matter how good you are, it really doesn‚Äôt matter in the end if your team is not good, you‚Äôre going to get punished for the overall team play. It‚Äôs like some subconscious message that no matter how great you play, doesn‚Äôt matter because it‚Äôs not really up to you how you rank it‚Äôs up to you‚Äôre entire team and that is very discouraging and demotivates players to keep playing
review_title: Love this game but Ranking needs to be reworked

review:
People on ranked this season are disconnecting, running at towers, and being way too negative. im playing pvp and other fun modes since I don‚Äôt feel like people are getting banned for verbal abuse.

Still, fun game, good design, except that there are small amount of ap items for mages. I think that what the balance team is doing is making some characters op to climb ranks with them, but I find that boring or with little skill. Right now pyke is op and they are planning a buff on him when i got a friend master with 75% win rate. 

If you want to climb play with friends or rabdoms online that do good on your games and use counterpicks. Its a 5v5 strategy game. Not a 1v9 game like youtubers want you to think.
review_title: Fun game but toxic on rank

review:
Well I have never been too much of a League of Legends fan, but I have played this game a bit on pc with my friends who are really into this game. I saw an ad that announced the mobile version and I immediately got it to check it out, finally a quality pc game on mobile! 
I think they did a good job adapting the game,but movement is way harder than on pc which is weird since on pc that only needs the mouse phones are touchscreen. But overall it‚Äôs a decent mobile adaptation, considering how crappy mobile games can usually be. But unfortunately I do not see that other game that is a part of league of legends, that is like a board game i can‚Äôt remember what it‚Äôs called.

But I am disappointed by two things. 
1. At first I thought this was a major flaw but I sorta understand it. You can‚Äôt cross-platform with pc! I thought it would be great to play with my friends on their PCs from anywhere on my mobile device, I thought this could be really awesome but I guess they don‚Äôt want that.
The worst thing is that Champion unlocks and character skins  do not transfer over. This is super unfortunate, this basically means I will have less fun and less reason to play the mobile version, since my progress and skins are on PC. This is super unfortunate!

The game is fun to this extent but has a major downfall , graphics and characters all are well done and are really amazing. But the major rework that needs to be done is in the game modes like aram and ranked pvp. The ranked system puts you as a newbie against premade teams and people who play in upper tear ranks such as masters. The teams usually win giving you the new player a 9 loss streak. The randoms are literally bots or they don‚Äôt care to win and aren‚Äôt competitive. Remakes are possible but only for the opposite team. Most of the time the team wants to surrender before the match starts. I don‚Äôt know if the issues are based on it but it seems as if some players are more preferred to others. The main thing you reading this should take out of all this is don‚Äôt try to win and don‚Äôt be a high kills person or you will loose and be stressed while staying addicted to the game.

Love the gameplay, graphics, interactions, but I have a few issues. Starting with the bots that are automatically added if there aren‚Äôt enough players, they will go certain lanes regardless of players calling the lanes and pinging them to retreat. They will feed enemy teams as well not retreating from turrets. Secondly and final issue is if you idol in a lobby even if you don‚Äôt initiate the match it will penalize you, because of this error in the system I haven‚Äôt been able to join or create a guild since I started playing. I‚Äôm pretty sure they will ignore my review as most creators do, but if you guys do see this I‚Äôm not the only one who runs into this problem. Thank you, and otherwise a beautiful game and great gameplay addicting even.

I love League Of Legends and it‚Äôs so great to see a mobile game from Riot that somewhat replicates it with various differences put in place to enhance the playability on the phone or tablet. I‚Äôve spent easily 2 hours already just looking at the champion skins and the animation that goes with them. The gameplay is simple but takes strategy at the same time. The tutorials are fast, easy, and they had a solid flow to them so they didn‚Äôt get boring. I have terrible ADHD and ‚Äúalready know how to play League‚Äù so that‚Äôs surprising. But by far the best thing about this game is the combination of graphics and in-game music. Absolutely immersive and crisp graphics with an exciting and fun soundtrack, plus it has most of my favorite champions? Sign me up any day! 

Thanks Riot

I mean it‚Äôs a game I wanna play, but it‚Äôs not like I wanna play everyday of my life for the next 80 years. I left 5* so people would see it my real review is 3 stars.

review: Whatever update Riot did to the game made S10 a absolute joke! Grandmasters got reset to Emerald while noob in low tier kept their low ranks. How do u expect good play too‚Äùcarry‚Äù every game to be able to win? This game this season is serious the worst it‚Äôs ever been. Im a 4 time grandmaster who stuck in emerald/diamond this season bc you guys and your outrageous matchmaking system is trashed pairing good people with peak emerald players, players who can‚Äôt build right, don‚Äôt know macro, or players who don‚Äôt even know how to use their own hero‚Äôs to keep matches ‚Äúbalanced‚Äù. Such a waste of time if u guys don‚Äôt fix things this game is going to be trash along with the rumors that are going around already that your doing it on purpose to force people to start new accounts to buy more skins. You guys are the absolute worst! Don‚Äôt play this game if you want to be mad all the time because if you‚Äôre a good player you‚Äôre just going to get screwed

The game itself is great. Has decent rank grind and classic items. The matchmaking needs work but is slightly made up for with polished graphics. The thing that irks me the most is the lack of legends and lack of things to grind for. Motes are hard to come but and skins are even harder. The game has a nice simplicity about it that makes it easier for non pc players to enjoy. I would say it‚Äôs perfect for people who want to get in to league. The things that could be done to fix the game are listed below:

-Have events more often with limited prizes that are worth grinding for.

-Fix matchmaking (this is almost universal with all games, does not mean we like playing with bronze players while in platinum).

-Release more legends!

-Reward the players with decent loot and something to play for! 

-L, harsher bans for people who stay afk the entire game or intentionally feed!

Final notes, this game has potential to be amazing but the devs seem to have their mind elsewhere. If they change it up, Great! If not I‚Äôll still play. But if you want more players to stay in game, don‚Äôt cater to one audience and make it work a persons time. Also we want Cho gath!

I got to daimond 3 weeks ago and I feel like I completed the game. After daimond the only difference in skill level became grinding. The ones who put in the time can get challenger but for me it‚Äôs not worth it. I haven‚Äôt played since I got daimond because this game is stressfull to play and will ruin your mood for the day. The only time I enjoyed the game was when it was new when I was learning the game step by step improving everyday. I guess I get frustrated at this game because you have little control to carry compared to shooters like pubg and codm which are less stressfull to play. To anyone who wants to try this game it‚Äôs fun for a while try it rank up and play with people that‚Äôs where to fun is at.

review:
Hello, 

First and foremost, the game is extremely balanced with robust characters. However, one thing that I find lacking is the amount of competitiveness. The game is in a great spot but out plays are basically none existent unless you are a character that has CC or huge burst damage. Characters die too fast while items that gives magic resist and armor provide less survivability. Tanks such as Mundo are the only ones that can fully utilize equipments like the tank item that increases healing. Not only that, healing or life steal are nonexistent. Soraka felt very useless with the amount of healing she dishes out. Please make the game more brawl like and not too fast paced. I would not mind if the game goes to 25 min. Thank you.

Honestly, this is a nice refresher from League PC. If your dislike of this game Is because it‚Äôs not the same, then you‚Äôre the reason the game is toxic. This game takes everything I didn‚Äôt like about league PC, being the potentially looooong games, the overwhelming character list, the complicated meta that got difficult to keep up with, and simplified everything again. I‚Äôve played LoL since 2011 and have spent an inhuman amount of hours and money on it, but this version brought the fun back into it in my honest opinion. Any veteran league player should look at this game from a different perspective rather than just blatantly compare the two and hate how different it is.

I was skeptical at first since I played League of Legends of 10 years, but this is definitely a fresh new look with quick gameplay. My friends and I have been spamming this game everyday since it‚Äôs release and haven‚Äôt played the PC game since. Even with the same champions, it feels like a new game since gameplay and overall game time is quicker than usual. It really gives players who don‚Äôt want to commit an hour to a game on the PC version an option to play a full game within 15-20 minutes. I was worried that champions would be impossible to play without a keyboard but they really modified champion skills to ensure that each champion is easy to use.

I‚Äôm having a lot of fun playing Wild Rift, but I wish the controls were similar to Vainglory‚Äôs controls. With the current system, advanced mechanics like kiting don‚Äôt really exist since you can hold the fire button and it does it for you. This is a common theme in the game. To fit with the current system they have, there is auto-targeting and auto-aim, among other things. This makes it very easy to the point where difficult champions like Katarina, Zed, and Yasuo can just absolutely mash their buttons and almost always hit their target. Vainglory‚Äôs system leaves more room for skill, less clutter, and it just feels so much better. Make an option for touch controls instead of only the joystick and you‚Äôve got yourself the best game on the AppStore.
review_title: I love it, but not a fan of controls.

review: I am a huge fan of mobile gaming. One of my favorite type of genres to play is MOBA type games. I have tried all types of MOBA Games and out of all of them Mobile Legends was the best options available, at the time. But Mobile biggest problem was how unbalanced the characters were. Someone can SOLO the entire team. Buuutttt LOL is extremely balanced. These games take so much longer because it takes a team to win the game. The mechanics can‚Äôt be matched. It‚Äôs a billion dollar company for a reason. So if your competitive like me, and like teamwork, this is the game to play. Like every game updates will be constantly be coming out, but I rarely have any issues anymore since launch.

The gameplay is great but the one consistent problem I have is ranked trolls. What‚Äôs the point of having a role pick system if everyone always forces themselves into another role. Or then just duos in Baron Lane while they‚Äôre the jg and runs it down. Steals exp and CS and refuses to jungle. There needs to be a better training experience so that people take the roles they get and stop force filling because they can‚Äôt or refuse to do the role they‚Äôre given. It isn‚Äôt fair that I get forced to lose because I can win lane or do my role as best I can while the support picks Zed and runs it down trying for kills and repeatedly dies. Love the game otherwise and I don‚Äôt mind dealing with this in normals. Yet, we, those that actually do their roles as specified, have to be subjected to free losses because people intentionally troll or refuse to do their roles.

It reflects what kind of players are you by the experience you have. 
Of course I had headwind games, inting teammates and absolute rookies. I will try to spread some positives and plan the strategy instead of throwing F bombs. If they refused to listen, or have no intention to win, mute all and ff, because you have tried your best and face the reality. 
Disturbing players are everywhere, if you were dragged to their level, they will beat you by their self-justified stupidity or they just not learned yet. And you will get angry, which may harm your health. 
Spread positivity, focus on the game, do not argue, be a coolheaded player and you will realize how you react to the game is what the game can give you. 
GLHF ALL!
review_title: This game is like a mirror

review: The game is amazing so far, but I‚Äôve come across a problem with movement. There‚Äôs a delay for movement like when I move forward there‚Äôs a slight delay, and it‚Äôs the same with every other direction. When I stop moving there‚Äôs also a delay for my character to stop. Sometimes when I move my character will go the opposite way or go slightly off course. In one game I played my game was really buggy. The game would freeze and a thing came up saying game data loading. During that game the movement issues were more severe, and my character would sometimes clip through walls. Sometimes my character would keep moving for a while even after I let go of the virtual joystick. (Also there‚Äôs no tap to move option in the settings).

This game is really good fast paced fun good graphics almost identical to the PC version. However the player base is pure toxic, so many people rage quit or go ago if they didn‚Äôt get their lane or feel they not getting support or who knows but in my last 15 games there was at least one player on every game who quit...not go ago just sat in base running circles spamming surrender. There is nothing you can do but report it and I report players like that every time and even in ranked games when I report I doubt anything happens at all, there needs to be more accountability for players like this they‚Äôre ruining it for the rest of us...at least I know they ruined it for me I‚Äôve uninstalled for the time being

EDIT: submitting a support ticket for something built into the game is a worthless copy-paste attempt to hide the games clear faults. Nice try rito 

It is an established title. Lots to do. Easy to get into. Completely ruined by the system‚Äôs AFK and BOT situation‚Ä¶ If someone on your team loses connection, or simply leaves, they get controlled by the games AI which makes them die a LOT and make the enemy team stronger‚Ä¶ happens every time. Seams like almost every other match will get ‚Äúthrown‚Äù by the AI system. The other huge problem is the matchmaking system! If you start to win too many times in a row, the game will pair you with GARBAGE teammates to make sure you lose. There is no such thing as getting matched with players on your skill level. If you can get past those 2 things, then this game will be really fun for you actually!

review:
When I first joined, the game was alright. A new update came out rendered the game just unplayable it was patch 2.5 I was able to play but I felt like I was being matchmaked with unrankeds and silvers when ever I was in high plat about to hit emerald I think it may be getting better because in the last 50 games I‚Äôve played 2/10 times it was a completely inexperienced play but the rest of my teammates were my rank Ives seen this happen to the enemy team as well making the game too easy to the point where my team and I actually surrendered because we felt bad.

Haven‚Äôt had any problems as of recently so I think the devs might be doing something right.

After playing this game for some time and with other players around the globe. What I‚Äôve experienced is nothing but NEGATIVE ATTITUDES compared to other games like Arena of Valor and Mobile Legends. 

No one follows the roles even though it‚Äôs already preset as their strongest roles. And people like DarkRaven should never ever be allowed to play games like this ever. The amount of negativity and toxicity from him just put me off completely from this game. 

People like him should be completely blocked off from any game owned by this company. It just very off putting and just messes up with the whole experience. Been a fan but right now all I can say is this should be deleted off apps store until the developers can come up with a better control over how the community should be. 

Great game, big potential but sad about how it‚Äôs refereed. There should be a mental psychology test for each new account. The game characters and their speeds are quite slow too and it feels like you have to break the screen to just move your character to a certain fight area even with added speed. It was just starting to feel like a go to game but right now it‚Äôs just a place where psychos gather and share negativity or toxicity or just show their childish abused mental attitude. 

=====End=====

My problems are twofold: ranked matchmaking and toxicity?

In matchmaking, why do you even bother to ask what role you want to play when the percent chance you actually get it is so low. Why force players in RANKED who choose to specialize in a particular role to play things they don‚Äôt want to or are not good at which severely increasing the chances of you losing. Theres not a player in sight that wouldnt mind waiting a bit longer if it meant they always got the role they want in a given match.

While I‚Äôm at it, why does Riot continue to penalize people in ranked a loss when people go afk for extended periods in a match? A 4 v 5 matchup in most cases is a guaranteed loss. Why should everyone have to suffer for it? Thats not fair at all.

Now, the toxicity in this game has not improved at all. My friends and I left the PC version because of this and are about to do the same with mobile. Reporting legitimately bad behavior like threats or hacking does nothing. Instead, you get penalized time off of your play for reasons that aren‚Äôt within your control like a lapse in your connection.

I‚Äôm giving it a star cause I love the gameplay. However, the way the game‚Äôs handled is disappointing. The focus seems to be more on cashing in with fancy visuals than actual gameplay.
review_title: The song remains the same. Great game marred by disappointments.

review:
Every few games I get this prompt after champion select... and I have never been able to reconnect. After a few minutes of failure it says the the party has been disbanded. I‚Äôm not sure if everyone disconnects, since the matches never show up in my history. However, its still disappointing, and also cruel to my teammates if they don‚Äôt disconnect. I‚Äôm pretty sure its not an issue with my wifi since I don‚Äôt lag once actually in game.

Once that issue gets fixed I think I‚Äôll bump the review up to a 5/5 as the game is very enjoyable! As a dumb casual I would personally like more ‚Äúfor fun‚Äù game modes to be added since I know stuff like mirror mode exists on the PC version.

4/17 Update:
The glitch has not occurred for the past two days so perhaps it was patched. 

Adding role selection for ranked is great. Although I mostly go fill to mix things up. However, for the past 20 games while going fill, I got solo/baron/top lane. I don‚Äôt know if this is a glitch, weird luck, or if top lane is just very unpopular.
review_title: (Possibly fixed) Failed to connect to the match. Reconnect?

review: I‚Äôve really had a fun time playing this game. I really like this game a lot. Everything from the graphics, frame rate, and the overall smoothness and feel of the game. I‚Äôve been playing this game for a couple days now, and thought that it would be a good idea to share some of my thoughts. My only issue with this game is the lack of customization. The lack of customization makes it really hard to really customize your settings. Such as graphics settings, frame rate, (although frame rate is there, improved options would be great.) If you take all of those cons out of the prospective, it‚Äôs a flawless game. At the end of the day, I would absolutely recommend this game; bottom line.

I love it, the game runs smoothly, looks fantastic, is a true porting of League, but there‚Äôs one critical problem with the core gameplay loop:
Each game takes forever, and has often been decided before the match even begins by MM. you‚Äôll often find yourself 6 min in, and their Kayle is 3/0. There simply isn‚Äôt a good reason to keep playing, and it‚Äôs frustrating to know that you‚Äôve consigned another 20min of your life to playing it out.
There is a surrender option for games that have been decided, but it‚Äôs woefully underused. 2/5 players can hold the other three hostage in a completely lost game.

Is it any wonder that players are toxic when they realize a bad play means they‚Äôre spending the rest of their available play time going through the motions and getting one shot by fed opponents? 

The surrender threshold needs to be lowered, maybe dynamically with the scoreboard. If 2/5 want out when the score is 2/18 then they should be allowed out. 

This would have the added effect of competitively minded players needing to watch out and protect their team morale. If you actually need their votes to keep playing, you won‚Äôt be flaming them

I love this game, but matchmaking is absolutely garbage. Straight trash. Trolls, intentional feeders, and afks need to be punished more intensely. Solo queue needs to be so that your actually getting matched with people of your rank, not just in legendary queue. There‚Äôs no reason why bad teammates should be so consistent. I peaked at 48 points grandmaster mid season, and matches were not balanced when challengers aren‚Äôt on your side but on the other team only. Duo isn‚Äôt terrible, but point cut offs at 41 plus points are dumb for people who are the same rank but can‚Äôt queue with eachother. Trio takes forever to match make. End of season is terrible because people stop taking the game seriously. There needs to be a way for players to rate performance and be rewarded for playing with eachother, or if you perform well but lose not to take such a big mmr hit. Again, matchmaking is so bad. Just please fix matchmaking.

review: This game is absolutely incredible. Being able to port a game like League seemed impossible, but they have really done it! I am giving it 4 stars though because I think the game has a bit of improving to do. My biggest issue with the game is death timers. They become way too long too quickly in both ARAM and Summoners Rift. I understand that death timers shorten game time, but I believe there are better ways to keep game time short. Staring at a gray  screen for over a minute is not fun especially for a mobile game. Other things that can be improved is effectiveness of the report system and giving players feedback when they report someone that gets punished. Other than that this game is awesome! Keep it up!

review:
First off, this is a mobile game, mobile as in on your phone or tablet, but most likely phone. But it has a more severe AFK penalty than the PC version. I took a phone call for four minute in the middle of a match and came back to a ten minute ban because of 4 minutes of inaction in which a bot takes over for you, which is better than nothing like in the PC version. 

The game is great, it is League but quicker and honestly the PC version could learn a lot about pacing from this version. But the afk penalty needs to be severely reduced and I wold argue for the removal of it entirely. I would rather have a teammate go afk, my team lose the match, and be able to start a new game immediately then anyone be temporarily shut out of the game because they had to deal with real life.

All the negative reviews misrepresent this masterpiece. Matchmaking is phenomenal, reporting is very efficient, and most players are pretty good. 

Wild Rift is more convenient and enjoyable than PC league. Wits are relied upon solely now that everyone shares the universal thumb-to-screen experience. It doesn‚Äôt take much practice to get comfortable with the controls, and that‚Äôs the only hurdle to overcome if you‚Äôre used to PC league. Events make this game extremely rewarding to play. I don‚Äôt remember PC league ever having events that are so satisfying. I‚Äôve played PC since early season 2 and I‚Äôve never seen an event that awards you a champion, let alone a newly released one, but this is commonplace in WR.

Love this game so much it‚Äôs crazy. I got this game back in I want to say March and I‚Äôve ignored my other games to play only this because of how balanced and well a game can play with even light communication and teamwork. Unlike other mobile games even other MOBA‚Äôs they pale in comparison to wild rift due to teamwork being the key to a good match that has resulted in a victory. I‚Äôve yet to play ranked matches due to talk about it becoming extremely competitive when in ranked and I would rather enjoy the game made for fun. 

Overall this game is great for a mobile and I can‚Äôt wait to see it continue to improve throughout time :)
review_title: Amazing and still has potential to get even better

review:
I have been a long time player of the pc version of league of legends. I love the game and was extremely excited to play. Unfortunately, starting the game with not a shred of what I earned in the pc version was disappointing. Matches are often unorthodox and dysfunctional as new players and stubborn community members fight each other for champions and positions in blind pick, often leading to unbalanced team comps and miscommunication in the way of role picking.

Don‚Äôt be surprised if you get three marksmen on one team, one of which decides to be in every lane at least once in the first 5 minutes of the match, and they aren‚Äôt even jungling.

Personally won‚Äôt be playing much more until draft pick is introduced to normal pvp and/or player experience is matched up better.

the game works very well and the tutorials, while long and sort of non-efficient at times, explain what's needed to know for new players and those coming over from PC LoL. there are some issues like cancelling auto attacks, but otherwise pretty much all of the bugs found in PC version are nonexistent in Wild Rift, which is fantastic. 
some improvements that i think would be nice:
-optimize the targeting options to not cancel an auto midway 
-allow the use of abilities while auto-pathing somewhere (e.g., i have pathed to top lane and want to use a speed-up ability to get there). currently, this is not possible and the character stops moving if they use an ability while auto pathing.
-in targeting options, separate minions and champions for the options of "Target by Lowest Health (Absolute)" and "Target by Lowest Percentage Health"; I've missed a couple of minions due to the auto target honing on the half health cannon even though there are casters about to die.
-make poses non-specific to skins, at least the ones that apply to the base skin; poses are a strange add-on to ask money for, so please make them more usable
review_title: honestly a great and refreshing way to play league

review: If you think you‚Äôre playing the esport version of the game, think again.  Get ready to have abilities fail to trigger, snowball games that start about 30 seconds in, and trying to make sure you‚Äôre picking the ‚Äúchampion of the the week‚Äù because balance is only a theoretical concept.  On top of that you have toxic players that add that extra little bit of spice to create the full gambit of an awful experience. I don‚Äôt want to pick on the devs too much, and it‚Äôs amazing what they have accomplished. But when reaction time and accurate aiming matters, a touch screen just doesn‚Äôt do it.  I‚Äôve had spells fire in random directions, spells fail to trigger, or a latency spike that left me dead before I had any chance to react.  This game is a lesson in frustration and futility.  If you want to pley league of legends, the play the real thing and don‚Äôt waste you time with this.
developerResponse: {'id': 33173024, 'body': 'Please reach out to us with a ticket at https://support-wildrift.riotgames.com/ and we can figure out what happened!', 'modified': '2022-11-15T12:06:18Z'}

review: I understand leaving can be frustrating for the other people but people have emergencies or even have to pick up a call/FaceTime. The game is extremely fun except two problems. One of which is banning people for leaving even though its not a ranked game. Secondly, why does the ‚Äúbattle pass‚Äù not reward you with cores so you can repurchase the battle pass next season with rewards (like Fortnite, COD or any other popular games), instead you want players to pay again and again for new ‚Äúseasons‚Äù.  If its to make revenue for a new game i understand but if you want people to play consistently, you must reward them likewise so you keep players wanting to comeback. The game otherwise is a solid top 10 mobile game of all time.
review_title: Fix these two problems for a larger audience

review: I have been playing league of legends on pc since 2014, when they came out with this for the app, I was so excited to get it since then, my eye and hand coordination has gotten way better and for the first time in many years I have finally gotten a penta kill something I have never been able to accomplish on the PC version, so I‚Äôm very thankful the graphics of the game are great gameplay can be iffy sometimes but overall great champion selection great game so many possibilities however I do wish that all of the champions that are on league PC was also available for the app as well that would be amazing! Thank you so much!

I‚Äôve always enjoyed MOBA‚Äôs even though I‚Äôm not great at them. League on PC is a game I go to when I can and I absolutely love it (even though I get destroyed!) but with 4 kids, and a full time job running a small business, my time is limited. Riot has managed to pack the spirit, and feel of League into this amazing mobile package, allowing for games that typically last no more than 20 minutes. Sure, PC is where it‚Äôs at if you have the time, but I‚Äôm always on the go, and find that Wild Rift is the perfect fit for me. Plus my sons can team up with me on their mobile devices while we are on the go! Great work by all involved. I love this game.

I‚Äôm a diehard VainGlory fan, so making the switch to league wasn‚Äôt easy. Big learning curve trying to understand all of the champion mechanics. But let me tell you, worth it. Super fun game and skill expression is there for sure. If you want to learn quickly how the champions work, play a lot of ARAM and get into practice and learn how the champion that was lighting you up works. Didn‚Äôt take me too long to figure it out and now I‚Äôm climbing the ranks. Just wish NA had esports scene still. Would be amazing if they brought that back, even if it was low budget virtual stream. I don‚Äôt need the stadium and lights to enjoy the best of the best in my region going at it

I am a big fan of mobas. I‚Äôve been playing them since Dota appeared on battlenet for Warcraft. Wild Rift is fun, it moves quickly, the models are great, the skins are fun‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs a well made game. My biggest issue with games like these is when heroes get so unbalanced that they can 1 or 2 shot their way through an entire team. If certain heroes in wild rift get a few kills ahead, they practically become unstoppable. Should playing well give you an advantage? Yes. Should some heroes be so overpowered they decide the game that you‚Äôre locked into for 30 minutes? It makes the game really frustrating.
Also, the decided lack of balance when someone leaves the game is hard to handle. Most other games grant you extra gold or negate your loss or some concession when a teammate drops.

I downloaded this HOURS ago and every time I try to play, it says ‚ÄúFailed to connect to the match, Reconnect?‚Äù an I‚Äôll try over an over an it continues to say the same thing. I can play Mobile Legends an other games just fine. This is the ONLY game with a problem. I‚Äôve been trying to play for HOURS. It‚Äôs happening to a lot of other people too, it‚Äôs all over Reddit. The Devs don‚Äôt do anything about it but make excuses an tell you to restart your WiFi router even if you aren‚Äôt on WiFi. Games worthless. I‚Äôve been waiting for this for forever an was super stoked to play. All that time wasted because they can‚Äôt fixed a simple connection issue. Even games for babies work, why isn‚Äôt this ‚ÄúNew Amazing‚Äù game working? I‚Äôm kinda disappointed tbh. Hopefully they fix this. This games coming out with a horrible start. By the time the actual game comes out, no one will want to play it.
developerResponse: {'id': 21968999, 'body': "Hi Cornell E,\n\nNothing can ruin a game like connection issues, and we'd like to help. Please submit a ticket on https://support-wildrift.riotgames.com/ and we'll see if we can figure this one out.", 'modified': '2021-03-31T10:52:29Z'}

review:
I have been living this game since I got it and have zero problems with the gameplay or design. I would highly recommend this game to anyone
The only problem I have is that occasionally I will receive a warning and a small suspension from matchmaking at random.
The problem is that at no point recently have I ever entered matchmaking and not selected to enter the match so I have no idea why this game thinks I am doing this.
Other than that small thing which is really no problem at all it‚Äôs just weird and hard to explain, this game is absolutely amazing and I have no regrets about playing it
review_title: Amazing game with one tiny problem

review:
I‚Äôd give this game 5 stars as soon as they fix the ranked games afk issue. I was just in a ranked game and a teammate went afk so we did a 4 man surrender and after the game we still lost rank and it didn‚Äôt even say in the post game scoreboard that the teammate went afk when it‚Äôs supposed to have a little afk symbol. Fix this and it‚Äôs 5 star.

Update: there is no afk penalty system at all, and you still lose rank from losing a game with an afk teammate. It‚Äôll say he‚Äôs afk and ask if you want them to be controlled by AI and everything. But post game there‚Äôs no ‚Äúleaver‚Äù icon and everyone loses rank. Not worth playing when you‚Äôre punished for teammates afk

ANOTHER UPDATE: nothing has changed. Ranked matches with afk players still ruin your rank with no punishment system. Doesn't even register they're afk postgame. Tons of other bad reviews for same issues. RIOT doesn‚Äôt care. More skins and money grabs!!!

review: I enjoy this moba a nice character list with several classes to main. My only gripe is that I believe the nexus need to be buffed. I‚Äôm coming from mobile legends and their version of the nexus last longer. In wild rift when the minions get in your or the enemies base it‚Äôs pretty much a gg. Also maybe bump up the movement speed for all characters by like .3 or .5 . Other than that I enjoy how accessible your moba is and the ability to get motes easy and unlock characters without being to grindy is awesome. I also like how unique the skins for the characters are it‚Äôs refreshing because a lot of mobas steal skins from eachother but not this one. 5 ‚≠êÔ∏è game but 4 ‚≠êÔ∏è because I believe nexus should be buffed.

Hi! I‚Äôm writing this review in frustration with the ranked game made on wild rift. I have played league of legends since season 3 but stopped playing due to lack of a PC. When this game came out I was overcome with joy, it brought nostalgia that I deeply needed. I just started dabbling in ranked mode, quickly climbed up to silver, but recently I queued up and the game immediately gave me 999 ping.. I checked my cellular and I was 3 bars of 5G.. then the game force-updated itself and I missed the first 10 minutes basically of a ranked game, that would of been fine if the ranked algorithm didn‚Äôt take me down to silver 4 from 3‚Ä¶ after it already did this once before and took me from 2 to 3. I love ranked and climbing but it‚Äôs completely unfair that I play ten games to get to silver 2 and then get demoted to the next tier down‚Ä¶ I won‚Äôt be playing this game for a while or spending anymore money on skins. This is bull‚Ä¶

review: Matchmaking is absolutely the worst part of the game recently. I‚Äôm Diamond 3 getting matched with Emerald 4s, sometimes even Platinum 1s. There is absolutely no reason the matchmaking should be this terrible. I have over a 60% Win rate, being thrown into lobbies with people who are in the mid 40s. All it does is trash the stats of people playing ranked and absolutely destroys the thought of skill-based ranked play. I would very gladly wait additional time in the queue over the possibility of getting teammates who simply are going to destroy my stats, which I have taken a lot of time and energy into maintaining. Please fix this riot. There‚Äôs no reason we should be paired with players who are a whole tier below us. Maybe +\- 1 rank would be okay, but anything else is just wasting ranked players time.

Embarrassing matchmaking, absolutely deplorable practice. If you do well enough, you will be placed with dogs on your team in order  to boost their rank and inflate the ranking system. This is the sorriest excuse for a competitive experience, I hope all the devs are ashamed of themselves. 
I‚Äôm a master/grandmaster player, and the sorts of players you run into on a daily basis vary by the widest margin. You‚Äôll have a good adc one game, the next an absolute brain deficient dog that lacks the most basic comprehension skills. 
It‚Äôs really sad though honestly, for a game that‚Äôs so well optimized for mobile to have such an embarrassingly low effort disgusting infected ranked system because the devs shill for big papa money maker and want degenerate monkeys to have fun even if that means tarnishing the game. 
All so that you invest more time to boost negative iq players so that they end up spending some money.
review_title: If you value your sanity, go elsewhere

review:
I‚Äôve played LoL for a long time, and I quit gaming on my PC because I enjoy this game so much. Anyone who says this game costs money to play is silly. You can‚Äôt use real money to progress in this game. It is all based on skill, experience, and how well you strategize your item purchases with currency earned within the arena.

If developers are reading this, I had an epiphany‚Ä¶ ARAM ranked please‚Ä¶ I enjoy ARAM a lot because they are short matches that are explosive and fun. I would like to see more development of ARAM and maybe throwing in tournaments, events, and prizes. Make it just as competitive as normal game play. I think this would improve the app dramatically.
review_title: Awesome Game and Free to Play

review:
They really nailed it. It feels like League of Legends in all the ways it should while being lighter and faster as a mobile version should. The controls are intuitive, the pace is quick but still meaningful, the champs play as they normally do, skillshots work surprisingly well, the interface is efficient, and it runs perfectly. (Tried it on both iPhone and iPad)

And that‚Äôs just the actual gameplay. They made amazing animations for tons of skins which wasn‚Äôt necessary but added flair and made the game feel alive. You can tell they really took their time and paid attention to the details to get it just right. And they nailed it
review_title: Exactly what mobile League should be

review: I‚Äôm not sure what‚Äôs the underlying problem with this game.. it has beautiful graphics and game play wish it did not seem like I was playing with bots from time to time and I hope I‚Äôm not being pushed fake information or that this game is using me to relay information. Because even when league of legends came out I just always enjoyed playing the game . I can‚Äôt really find new players to play consistently and use microphone . And maybe 1/20 people actually type back during game play but I do not think they take ranked seriously. I hope to not mislead people and I hope that I can use my phone to play video games and bide my time like a normal person instead of feeling like I‚Äôm being strung along playing with bots . -Johnlou

The one thing I‚Äôm going to complain about as a league veteran been playing since the beta and I wanted to enjoy playing on mobile as well but the one problems face when I play this game is that I‚Äôm always getting stopped from moving my character especially when I‚Äôm trying to kill an enemy champion it makes the game no longer fun because I can‚Äôt move nor can I press the abilities either at times and it just overall makes the game not playable and the fact that I‚Äôve played league for a long time on Pc and really never had problems like that in games it‚Äôs understandable it‚Äôs on Pc but I just want the same feeling of not getting stopped and not being to cast any abilities to get fixed because it‚Äôs just atrocious

This game is simply stupid for the fact at that your skins and characters don‚Äôt transfer from your original account that‚Äôs extremely absurds and dumb. All the money and time spent on the original game and you just start from scratch stupid, nothing about this is ‚Äúdifferent‚Äù the game play is the same but just mobile. It‚Äôs just stupid, I can‚Äôt transfer any of my accolades into my mobile account, riot needs too fix this or this is just a waster of time and nobody is going to start from scratch when you already have the original game. Such a stupid concept, that‚Äôs alone set the whole mood for my experience, and I‚Äôm extremely disappointed that riot thought it would be okay for veteran accounts to start, what idiot thought that was smart? How long as this game been out in China and Europe, and riot didn‚Äôt think about linking account through that was alpha and beta process.

review: Atm this game is leagues ahead of any other mobile MOBA I‚Äôve tried. It‚Äôs also the best for f2p players as the only thing money can buy you for an ‚Äúadvantage‚Äù is more champions to pick from, which you can unlock just playing so nbd. Most players have a champ pool of 3-5 that they focus on getting good with. The rest we just collect for fun. If you play ARAM mode (all random all mid) then your champion pool won‚Äôt matter at all because you get a random champion assigned to you from all champions in the game. Money is also good for skins and stuff, they are cool but that‚Äôs all they are, just a cool looking thing with no effect or extra strength.
review_title: Best mobile MOBA, best for f2p

review: I‚Äôve played league PC for about 8 years of my life starting in season 2. Now I‚Äôve fully switched to fully playing on the mobile version: Wild Rift. Overall the game is enjoyable, if you played on PC you‚Äôll definitely have a kick playing this game. At the heart of the game, it brings the game of league pc into easier smaller digestible bites that anyone can pick up. What I will say is that for high elo or if you wanna 5 man q the q times are hours long which is very unfortunate. Another thing that is very annoying in this game is the lack of punishment for being toxic. Sorry to all the new players who have to deal with it but you‚Äôll get used to it after playing a bunch of games.

I have played legue of legends for a very long time and I very much enjoy the pc version considerably. That being said, the Mobile version is lack luster in comparison. Some of the champs are broken and completely unbalanced. The sped up version of the games allows some champs to be virtually unkillable after 2 or three kills while some champs who are ahead in terms of kills have been nerfed significantly that they do little to nothing in team fights even with a considerable lead. I find that so odd and not fun to play with/against. I either curb stomp the opponents with these same champs that are broken or I struggle even with a lead on other champs. It‚Äôs probably because there‚Äôs not beta version but the balancing team should really work on that.

I love to play this game because it has a gameplay to it and it has characters that have ability‚Äôs like master yi. Master yi has a power to heal himself witch I like to use a lot and it is the first one to ungraded to max but back to the gameplay it is like a rpg in a way you can pick a path to go on and fight the enemy and I thing the Crystal at the end is harder than the turrets but it is easy because you have all the teammates to help you in that fight but the turret is harder because you have to fight with you and a teammate or yourself but it‚Äôs awesome to play through and I play both sides and I think both are really fun to play in and the enemy‚Äôs are easy to take out in defense.

The fundamental issue with Wild Rift is that LoL is a complex game. Most people who are downloading and playing Wild Rift are not familiar with the game or MOBAs whatsoever. This leads to every game having 2-3 teammates that either feed or are entirely useless. I have seen 4/5 members of my team take smite before and have 3 top lane. It makes me more frustrated than actual LoL as most games are either won or lost before champ select is over since you may end up with smite lux top lane, instantly losing you the game. The game itself, however, is actually well made which makes the bad player base that much more frustrating. I'm not sure what Riot could actually do to make this playable but in its current state it is not worth playing.
review_title: Very well made, yet still frustrating and unfun

review: I loved the game and I‚Äôm glad I can play league of legends on mobile now since I don‚Äôt have a pc. But my main concern is the banned system when you go afk. I know in a team game it‚Äôs bad to go afk when your trying to win a game liked rank but when you get like a hour banned on a games against bots?? I just don‚Äôt understand that at all, sometimes something pop up and you have to put down the phone and a hour for being just afk? I know this game is where toxicity grew up but it a bit much in my opinion. It‚Äôs a awesome game! Love it but just being punish for sitting away for more then a minute is bad for me.
review_title: Awesome game! But the afk system...

review: I‚Äôve put in my time on this game and solo queued to Diamond 1 in my first season and ranked is absolutely horrendous. Matchmaking system is totally busted and if you go on a win streak it‚Äôs going to put you with the worst players possible to end that streak. Most of the high ranking grandmaster and challengers team up and will only play ranked with 5 men parties so don‚Äôt let the inflated ranks fool you. If you‚Äôre a solo queuer avoid ranked because it‚Äôs just going to lower your life span. I mean seriously people in Diamond play like it‚Äôs their first time playing a moba an when you look at their Match history you‚Äôll see every game they‚Äôve went 0/10/3 from mid or top or jungle and still win? Clearly they shouldn‚Äôt be in that rank but somehow they‚Äôre carried to Diamond because the system wants people to continue to play and have progression.
review_title: Matchmaking in this game is absolute garbage.

review: I far enjoy the faster pace of this game over the original. I can play a few games and not have to spend hours online. However, the devs need to get their matching process fixed ASAP. There are a high percent of players (or possibly bots) that join a match and immediately AFK. They are penalized but it still ruins the match for other players when 20% or more of the team is ineffectual because of the AFK. In ranked mode, this is pretty much a guaranteed loss for the other players. The devs need to give the team with an AFK player a free point loss shield when playing ranked ‚Äî in addition make the penalty for AFK harsher the more times you do it during a rolling 7 day period, regardless of whether you‚Äôre in ranked or casual.
review_title: Good MOBA but could be great with matching changes

review: It‚Äôs like having bots on your team, even at a high lvl rank, you get stuck with the most passive players, junglers that don‚Äôt fight or gank or help lanes. Made it to diamond it doesn‚Äôt get any better‚Ä¶ and no giving them money doesn‚Äôt make it any better either‚Ä¶. I‚Äôve never seen such a bad match making system on a moba before‚Ä¶.. always have had 80+ win rate every moba game because they have me a team that fights, not a team that feeds and trolls. My win rate on this moba is 50% yet I‚Äôm mvp/svp over 33% of all games‚Ä¶.. higher you climb the worse it gets, because higher chance of you having enemies of decent skill‚Ä¶ and 4 feeds and you bed 5 half decent players you can‚Äôt win, can‚Äôt carry hard enough, it‚Äôs impossible. Mobile Legends has this game beat 100fold‚Ä¶. And I thought that game sucked but then I played this
