review: The quality of this game is amazing, from the graphics, sound design, even menus and controls on mobile. I‚Äôve been playing since it‚Äôs release in the americas and have been really enjoying it, I‚Äôve tried league on pc before but could just never find the time to sit down and play a 30+ minute match that could result in a loss. While a match here lasts around the ballpark of 20 minutes, it adds up with every game taking less time, it also does this without sacrificing much of the complexity of the game. It‚Äôs a really well polished game and definitely more than just a port of pc league.

Game in amazing, but the matchmaking is terrible. Too many people go afk ruining your game and win rates, too many people in higher ranks that don‚Äôt know what they‚Äôre doing with their selected champion or role. Game need bigger penalties for arks and trolls. I recommend not allowing people to que rank unless they have good credit(don‚Äôt go afk often). Also don‚Äôt let them select champions they have t got a mastery level with or certain number of games played. Should also match up based on k/d, win rate, and rank. Should emolument a role rank system too because someone might be diamond tier jungle but silver tier support. Id rather it take 3 to 5 minutes finding a good and balanced game then to be just threw into the game as fast as possible with a bunch of lumps who don‚Äôt know what they‚Äôre doing.

This game is three stars max and barely three 
But I‚Äôm being nice the memes you see about this game are true it‚Äôs toxic as a mf a lot of ppl aren‚Äôt even good they just get carried by good players and the lag spikes you will get in this game will send you to outer space you could have your graphics all the way down running at 52ms for a solid 10 minutes then it will lag spike you to 500+ we‚Äôll after 13 mins so if you like being frustrated playing a game you will make no progress in only to but trolled by players that have up mentally because they aren‚Äôt the leader of the group then go for it
review_title: This problem is so bad I‚Äôll take time out of my day to make a review

review: This game is absolutely amazing! I played the former Mobile Legends so I derived some of the strategy from there. It really helps to have some experience in the field because this game can be overwhelming. However, once you get into the actual gameplay, you‚Äôll learn to love this game. The character selection and class are probably my favorite, but make sure that you check how hard heroes‚Äô difficulty is because when you begin it, it can be hard to play. I have been waiting for the longest time for this game to finally come to mobile, and this does not disappoint! Thank you Riot Games!
review_title: Amazing Gameplay. But you‚Äôll have to experience it yourself.

review:
If you perform to good than you get matched up the next few games with teammates that have seemingly no game knowledge. So now it‚Äôs like you have to 1v5 or 2v5 and try to carry people in the most absurd ways. Skill based matchmaking is a joke. This game easily compensates low level skill players with ranks they don‚Äôt deserve to make them feel better. In order to try and keep them feeling like they are making progress climbing the rank ladder with little to no skill improvements or game knowledge. They try adding all these bonus grinding loots which are visually appealing from the emotes and skin perspective. But looking cool feels stupid in comparison to a balanced match between teams for a competitive setting in ranked. 

The game has nice visuals. But it seems to pray more on small dopamine releases. Making you want to play more and more.
review_title: A true freemium experience (not the best game)

review:
I don‚Äôt understand the 4 out of 5 stars compared to the other mobile mobas. This one is by far the best one in quality and lore. It‚Äôs league for mobile. Riot did a great job with this one making it nearly competitive to its PC counterpart. Graphics are top notch, gameplay is smooth as silk, no pay to win elements just skins and champions, creative skins, seamless transfer from PC skill sets to mobile joystick controls, great sound and voice acting, additional skins from their Netflix Arcane show, endless skill customization, and constant events.

Definitely deserves more players and at least a 4.5 out of 5.

I‚Äôve known League of Legends for awhile but I‚Äôve never had a chance of playing it because I didn‚Äôt have gaming PC. I‚Äôve played other games like this before but Wild Rifts is better than them because it has more balance, communication, assigned character roles, equipment roles, side missions are fair, game options, and it‚Äôs not too confusing.

Since Wild Rifts came out I‚Äôm really happy to finally experience League of legends despite it not all PC characters but I‚Äôm also glad that I‚Äôm experience Wild Rifts along the Arcane series.

Thank you developers for making this happen, you‚Äôve put a lot of effort into this app.

I love wild rift me and my dad play it together a lot but know I can‚Äôt.   I will go to turn it on the first loading screen is fine it‚Äôs good üëçüèº but then I click play on next loading screen and it say WIFI connect failure cannot connect with servers. And my wifi is good full bars all other games work I‚Äôve turned my tablet completely off and back on, nothing. I unplug router, nothing and I haven‚Äôt been able to play for days pls hurry I need my Wild Rift!
 
P.S. I almost deleted EVERYTHING ON MY TABLET AND FINALLY it Downloaded so ad an option where you can play with the old updates on the game for ppl who don‚Äôt have a lot of space.

The original game has its flaws, but this game has too many flaws to begin with. First of all I don‚Äôt think the lanes should switch depending on the side you‚Äôre on, it‚Äôs not like this on league of legends at all, also the rp like currency is too expensive as well as the skins considering you can only buy one or two skins with said amount you buy. It‚Äôs also hard to aim and dodge abilities and I hate aiming so I don‚Äôt do that in the actual game with a marker telling me where I need to aim, I just think this game needed a bit more work before being released, but I‚Äôm giving the graphics a 10/10 because you all put tons of work in the characters faces and designs and the original doesn‚Äôt do that at all.
review_title: Good But Nothing Like The Original

review: Seriously amazing!! They made the game quicker, easier and more aesthetically pleasing. I haven‚Äôt been big on playing the original version on my laptop because it would drain my battery and one game would take almost half an hour(sometimes more), which means I‚Äôd only get to play like one game for the amount of effort it would take my poor laptop to load/run LOL. This version is even nicer than the original, yet it barely does anything to my battery! For real, I never review anything because I am very rarely impressed by an app, but this mobile version is absolutely amazing!! And it‚Äôs free!! Mad props to riot and LOL for surpassing any and all expectations I had for this game!

The matchmaking system in this game is completely horrendous. You will be matched with teammates that are at the lowest skill level you can ask for, where as the enemy team will likely have an entire team filled with experienced players. I don‚Äôt hate the game, it‚Äôs fun! However, the matchmaking system needs to be adjusted to make the entire lobby fit your skill level. It‚Äôs not hard to ask for something so simple, and yet, riot games still can‚Äôt do it after so many years released. You could be going 10-0 in lane and end up going 12-9 and losing the game because the other laners on your team are going 0-10. This is an unfair advantage and this needs to be addressed by SOMEONE. This is my honest opinion, and I‚Äôm sure is shared by multiple players. I am Diamond, playing with teammates who play like they‚Äôre silver.

The oddest, most absurd choice in mechanics happen at the most inopportune time, usually in the enemy unit‚Äôs favor. Manual select their unit for whatever cc skill, game decides to spend it on a creep. Manual (flick) a lethal skill shot, game decides to spend it on their most healthy unit. BLINK to cc, and it‚Äôs somehow not your obvious choice target but a nearby creep/tank.

Manual target is too vague and too broad, and I shouldn‚Äôt have to calibrate settings just for it to function as what I assume is intended (when other mobile games do NOT give me this issue).

Ranked, as always, is a mess, and with a substantially smaller player base than source game, this system could have been better. Never quite believed 50pct forced winrate. This app has me thinking otherwise.
review_title: Currently Diddle the Anus that is D1 and Master

review: It‚Äôs similar to League PC version but slightly different. It‚Äôs easy to dive into whether you are an old or new player. The controls feel really solid and the animations are on point. I have never encountered any bugs in my plays so far. It brings all the excitement and enjoyment from pc version with shorter match duration. The things I want improved are for fair matchmaking and harsher punishments for AFKers and trolls. The developers also really seem to care about the community and the overall gameplay so I can imagine myself playing this for so many years to come.
review_title: Hands down the best MOBA on mobile !

review: Guys. I get it - you‚Äôre trying to create an environment of team play for everyone. This, however, as we all know isn‚Äôt the desktop version - we see the limitations too and acknowledge that this game is going to lack because it wasn‚Äôt designed for mobile. Ok - that said - stop punishing us for leaving a game or whatever. Your algorithm kicks in and AI plays. We‚Äôd play the desktop version if we had time and were serious players - keep punishments up there. When my three year old wakes up bc she pooped her pants - ya gonna have to leave the game. This is a wonderful platform for us causal types (have a life and kids and a job) to experience lol. Don‚Äôt freaking lock us out when we are playing in the casual platform.

Games amazing I mean it‚Äôs League Of Legends!!! But on mobile but what I believe is that it needs controller support!!! Soo many amazing characters but it‚Äôs extremely hard to use jus with fingers , nd as well controller support would bring a huge following to the game , considering now everyone‚Äôs gaming on there phones nd there‚Äôs a bunch of people joining the gaming world . Although there‚Äôs issues with getting even into one game because there‚Äôs not many players on , but I believe that‚Äôll change once controller support is added , it‚Äôll be an easy plug nd play type game . Nd with how technology is evolving I believe mobile game will become the new console if not it already has only thing we are missing is more controller support games nd league will be a huge hit if it add Controller support !!

Honestly they don‚Äôt care about there player base and it‚Äôs so evident in this game‚Ä¶ if you guys want a community full of non English speaking people where all they do is Match make the winners with bad people and the bad people with winners this is the game for you. I have over 300 screen shots where my team intentionally feeds where they go 0-12‚Ä¶.0-17‚Ä¶.1-9 and so on where it isn‚Äôt just one person feeding but the whole team. That‚Äôs 300 games out of roughly 400. Do they ban these players? No do they do anything to help the players get good teams? No‚Ä¶. Do they try to rework the match making so feeding people with a 10% win rate aren‚Äôt on your team when you have a 40-70% win rate? No they don‚Äôt care and it is so frustrating in ranked when your team feeds and feeds and feeds and feeds and feeds and they do nothing about it‚Ä¶.

review: Dont kid yourself League of Legends is 100% paid to win. This is called DDA(Dynamic Difficulty Adjustment). Normally, good players dont need to pay and usually (top 5% of skill players)wins 80-90% of their games. so they sell their 40%wins(90-40=50% wins) to bad players(to get 50%) since dumb guys tend to pay(selling them your 40% ‚Äúextra wins‚Äù to make them happy). So dumb guys come back thinking they‚Äôre good but its the 50%(to 90%) ‚ÄúAI controlled‚Äù (your character is only controlled by you half the time(filter by AI, if you good or very bad). RIOTshatCompany does a really good job hiding this. For a skill player its useless and meaningless because the game is Gpay2Win, its NOT straight, most definitely Pay to Win. You think you didn‚Äôt PAY but you did‚Ä¶ its an emotional-roller-coaster price you paid. RIOTshatCompany is selling your wins and your happiness to others who can‚Äôt win.
review_title: LOL not just Pay2Win its Gay2Win

review: The thing I appreciate most about this game is that for a mobile game there is so much tactility and real control playing with a touchscreen. I honestly understand why the developers are still working on the Console version, because I‚Äôm still trying to wrap my head around how its going to feel similar in any way with a controller. The fact that there is support for ProMotion makes playing so fluid. This is one of the few apps I feel properly takes advantage of any hardware that is thrown at it. I have midrange phones from 2016 that can still reliably run this. The game feels familiar, but is condensed into the best parts of the core game of league of legends

Honestly, I do enjoy this game but I've run into a few emergencies where I've had to stop playing. I wouldn't mind the temporary bans if I was just leaving because I was upset from losing. My issue is that I have no way of leaving without being punished for having to suddenly stop. If you can make a bot run my character while I'm inactive then you can have an option to make the bot take over without having to suffer such severe consequences for stopping when I‚Äôve had to handle an emergency that I have no control over. Other than that I don‚Äôt have that many issues with this game but I do think it‚Äôs unfair that there is no way to say that I cannot continue this game without being in trouble for it.

I‚Äôve been playing regular LOL for years , I‚Äôm about to have my first child and I‚Äôve been playing since I was a freshmen in high school. I have such a strong connection to this game and to finally have it at my fingertips anywhere is a dream come true, and I know you‚Äôll read app reviews sometimes and the review is good and everything and it‚Äôs obviously a paid review or something, but honestly from the bottom of my heart this game is very fun and LOL will always be a prime example of a game where the devs will ACTUALLY listen to their players, and be the perfect example of what a free to play game should be

So what happens when a teammate runs it down mid because one wrong thing happened? People usually say ‚ÄúJust report them‚Äù but this games report system is garbage. Rewards the retards and punishes the smart ones. Every game has a teammate hard feeding and when I report? 9.9/10 nothing happens. I‚Äôve so far seen one notification that my report went through even though I‚Äôve sent multiple for hard inters, afkers, and trolls. But nooooo you only get banned through the chat system. A couple bad things you say to the inters, afkers, or trolls and YOU get banned instead. Instead of punishing the people ruining this game, it bans the people that are actually trying to climb or have fun. The report system is garbage and the matchmaking is garbage. Multiple times have I had people 1-2 FULL RANKS below me enter my lobby somehow.
review_title: No report system and garbage matchmaking

review:
It‚Äôs been almost a month since I started playing wild rift and I have to admit that you guys did a really good job. I know it‚Äôs a new app so there are some things that needs fixing. Here are some bugs I have encountered so far:

- sometimes during a match the audio gets muted abruptly and that freezes the screen where players give a like to other teammates at the end of the match, therefore gives us no choice but to reset the app.

- when you transition from app to app for more than few minutes, wild rift automatically logs you out, but logs back in if you exit the app and open again or you can just log back in.

- Also the circular controller on the left bottom side of the screen is doesn‚Äôt work precisely and it feels kinda hard to go to directions you wanna go.

- also it would be nice if 2D animations of the champions were high quality. (Maybe it‚Äôs very pixelated only on bigger screens because I use iPad)

Thank you for your hard work and keep improving üòäüèπ

I do like this game a lot. I actually play it close to every day, it doesn‚Äôt have as many champs as the first game obviously but they are releasing new champs pretty often. Updates on the game have been good and the challenges and stuff you can get just from playing is nice as well. I all around like this game and the only reason I‚Äôm not giving it five starts is 1. Because they took ultra rapid fire away :,( and 2. Sometimes matchmaking isn‚Äôt the greatest. Especially with a lot of afk players. I think penalty for afk behavior should have more consequences. Ranked is overall ok but sometimes even the ranked game mode can feel a bit messy in matchmaking.

Played mobile legends for a long time and I'm so glad this came out. Much more skill oriented and champions are well balanced. Team composition matters in this game unlike some of the other apps. Experience some lag occasionally even playing on a new iPhone so must have a good phone to play this. One thing I think could be improved would be if on your friends list it shows which position / lane the friend prefers so that when inviting friends to play in ranked you know who to invite by which position you need filled. I think this would be a big improvement.
review_title: Great game, could use small improvements

review: They've still got a lot of work to do to make this game playable.   Constant failure to connect at game launch is frustrating.    There's a huge problem with every game, unless you know every player and their class by heart it's really difficult to know what spots your team needs to fill.   After everybody picks it will finally say "team needs" and show an icon that supposedly represents a missing role in the lineup, but some of the icons don't match the icons over the player menu.   Needs a map that shows who goes to what lane.  There's a map, but it's static and doesn't show which spots are filled.   The few times I've got to play the general gameplay is just ok.  I'll try back in a few months, there are better options for my time right now.
developerResponse: {'id': 25161615, 'body': "Hello Chopwhiz\n\nThat sounds like something we might be able to help you with! Send us a ticket at https://support-wildrift.riotgames.com/ and we'll try to get you back on track.", 'modified': '2021-09-17T10:25:20Z'}

review: Every update the game continuously gets worse. The gameplay, mechanics, and graphics are all fine. The player base just gets more toxic. More trash talk and it‚Äôs only among team members since they removed global. Ranked matchmaking is a complete joke. Even when hyper carry, matched with iron and gold you can‚Äôt make up the deficit in kills. Players don‚Äôt bother to lane, jungles who don‚Äôt gank or go after epics. And all you get in return is ‚Äúget good‚Äù or ‚Äúcry more‚Äù I started playing this game a couple years ago, Spend money on the passes and skins, and you get matched with players who grief all day long. Reporting does nothing, can‚Äôt remember the last time I got a notification for reviewing bad gameplay.

This has been a fun and great experience. The only issue I have with it is there seems to be little love for support classes. There are no awards other than an assist badge at the end of a match for a little self assurance you did well. I‚Äôve finished a match where a Malphite received MVP with 5 takedowns when my Thresh had 1 takedown and 17 assists. I didn‚Äôt even receive an A rating. Request if you can devise awards, incentives, or just spread the love. Otherwise the game is clean.  Great graphics, smooth gameplay, some balancing but you are on that. I totally recommend this game and I hope to see Supports get pulled from the shadows and get awarded for their efforts.
review_title: Great for all but support classes

review: I‚Äôm loving it so far, amazing job making it user friendly knowing how complex League of Legends is on PC it blows my mind that this is FINALLY available on mobile. My ONLY gripe is whenever there is a patch or update my game won‚Äôt work once I launch it so I have to delete the app and have to download it again from the App Store. I‚Äôm using an iPhone 11 plus pro. Please fix this bug, I‚Äôm not sure if any other users are having this problem but I‚Äôve been playing from launch and I‚Äôve had to do it twice. And yes I used WiFi and my phone was updated prior to trying to download the app directly from the App Store or in game. Thanks again for an amazing game.

This game is made very well however it is very and i mean very 50/50. Even if you have a really good game sometimes you still loose because teammates do very bad or even worse some people play ranked and have no clue what their doing and I‚Äôm a emerald and people still don‚Äôt know how to play. Also if you want a champion to play that will not die NO MATTER WHAT YOU DO play tryndamere. One of his ability‚Äôs allows him TO BECOME IMMORTAL WHEN HES ONE SHOT FOR ABOUT 10 SECONDS. Yup doesn‚Äôt that sound pretty fair. If you‚Äôre low health and shred him it won‚Äôt matter because he will not die and kill you instead. Isn‚Äôt that rewarding for being better. Things need to be nerfed/fixed before i give it anymore stars and it has a lot of work to do

I just started this game a week ago and the gameplay, the graphics, the champions, the skins and literally everything here is PERFECT! I really have nothing to complain except the commentary of the game, I feel like the sound when the commentary say ‚ÄòQuadra kill, Penta kill‚Ä¶‚Äô could be stronger lol.
 I used to be a Mobile Legends player for about 2 years now and I‚Äôll tell u what, MLBB will never be as good as LOL or Wild Rift no matter how much they try to copy, mark my words! Anyway, if anyone‚Äôs reading this comment while trying to see if they should download wild rift, I say go ahead and try it coz u won‚Äôt regret it at all!

I‚Äôve been playing league of legends for a few years now and gotten many characters and skins. When league of legends mobile came out I was super excited. When I went to log in for the first time on mobile it let me log into my riot account. But when it loaded in it was a lvl. 1 account with nothing on it. The only thing I dislike about this and is the reason I‚Äôm not going to be playing league on mobile is the fact I have to completely restart from lvl. 1 and can‚Äôt have the characters and skins on my pc account. Am I doing something wrong or does the account data really not link? If it doesn‚Äôt link I don‚Äôt see the point in playing mobile.

Don‚Äôt waste your time the games forces a 50/50 win rate. It does this by going by the ‚Äúteams total‚Äù mmr instead of ‚Äúyour/the individual‚Äù mmr when in q. A player who averages no less than 8 deaths a match out of 100+ ranked matches has a 49% win rate. So this person would be in platinum and would be climbing with a 50% win rate and having atleast 8 deaths a game. This is why every match is a complete stomp one way and there is no possibility for comeback. It‚Äôs 50/50 because of how the system works, not because of your skill level like it should be. Every update the balancing of items and champs gets worse which makes this problem even worse. The game is a worn out shell of the downgraded pc version and the sole purpose is of this app is microtransactions from kids who have access to their parents money.

I haven‚Äôt been playing league of legends the original pc version for a long time like about 2-3 years but I find it very fun and very exciting to play but since I‚Äôve lost my of I haven‚Äôt been able to play since but now that there‚Äôs a mobile version of the game it makes me happy I get to play my favorite game again even though it‚Äôs a challenge trying to learn the mechanics of playing it in mobile and learning to have fast reactions is like learning a whole new game again since I‚Äôm more used to keyboard and mouse now I have to rely on how fast my fingers can react all in all its a fun game  and I hate  dr. mundo.
review_title: It‚Äôs like a whole new challenge

review: I have been waiting for NA release since it was first stated Wild Rift was being made and going mobile. Definitely worth the wait! This game is amazing, and the changes make it feel better for the phone. I like the shop system, the ping system, and much more! Can‚Äôt wait to start grinding ranked! The only thing I‚Äôm not fond of is that (obviously) there‚Äôs super new players that have ABSOLUTELY no idea what they are doing, but that‚Äôs because they probably haven‚Äôt played LoL before! Had a Garen feed 0-12 last night I believe, but probably not his fault. Overall, amazing so far and can‚Äôt wait for future skins, champions, events and maybe even ARAM in NA!

Wild Rift has ranked, but you can‚Äôt pick your lane and there isn‚Äôt enough time to discuss before or between picks. You can‚Äôt tell if the Lux/Annie is going mid or support. You can‚Äôt tell if the Lucian wants adc or mid. You get in a game and three people want to play adc.

It would also be nice to pick the items you want to build while in the game so you can control suggested purchases. Right now you set the items you want before a game (or use the default) and if you decide you need to build something different the shop would suggest a 1050 gold purchase instead of the 500gold purchase to finish an item just because you‚Äôre building different from the preset build.

All and all a fun game, but has some work to do to improve ranked play.

Because ef Jesus ü§£
I totally am loving this game ESPECIALLY THE PRIDE STUFF! I‚Äôm so not great at it but I‚Äôm just starting out, especially going from Final Fantasy 14 MMO to this is pretty different. 
The graphics are *chef's kiss* the only thing that really bothers me is sometimes it takes 4+ mins to get into a PvP game. And that some people don‚Äôt know how to properly play lol (but that‚Äôs because I‚Äôm always a support because it‚Äôs the easiest ü§£ ) 
Overall I‚Äôm really glad that this game supports the LGBTQIA+ and I think y‚Äôall should download this, takes a bit to get used to, but eventually you‚Äôll get the hang of it! üòâ

So I saw this game and I was really excited to play it, but when I tried to create an account with Apple ID, it said I ‚Äúdid not meet the requirements to create an account‚Äù. And when I tried to create an account again, it showed me the same thing without letting me change my information or anything. I might have typed something wrong, but I don‚Äôt know what‚Äôs the matter. Can you guys look into it and tell me why I can‚Äôt create an account with Apple ID?
(I‚Äôll just give you five stars, a bit of encouragement to look into this)
review_title: Problem creating an account (Developers please read!!)

review:
I enjoy Wild Rift when I have teammates who don‚Äôt leave or if I could get into a ranked match which are low key dead

The problem: If enough people leave you should be able to leave rather than be forced to play with bots 

***Most important: this is a mobile game to play on the go, so why should I get an hour leaver buster for leaving the champion select screen? I‚Äôll leave because I‚Äôll get a call or something comes up and I don‚Äôt have time to play, rather than leave mid game I should be able to leave champion select, it‚Äôs annoying dealing with leave buster because I don‚Äôt have the time I thought I had to play*** should really be addressed
review_title: Good game but champion select leaver buster ruins gameplay

review: Stop with this type matchmaking, just because i am overall a good player doesn‚Äôt mean i want to carry games and babysit all day. 1 match we win with me having 16 kills and 3 deaths and the next thing i know im playing with teammates with their heads cut off in the next 10 matches, Resulting in 10 loses.  At some point it gets annoying and frustrating to play this game just because of this one reason. Characters and items are not a problem, it‚Äôs the matchmaking. I would rather have bots as teammates than to play with players that the game intentionally matches you up with in order to help them win. Not playing this game anymore until further update to this horrible matchmaking, it‚Äôs the most annoying thing in the game.
review_title: Bad matchmaking(bad teammates back to back)

review:
I have a full party of 5, but we can‚Äôt ever find a game! It takes at least 5 minutes if you‚Äôre really lucky, otherwise 15 minutes+ to just find a game with a full party!!! Most of the time, we just get fed up of waiting for a game and then quit until later. 

I get it, I mean the developers want to match up a full premade 5 man team with another 5 man team, but there‚Äôs literally almost no one forming 5 party teams in the whole NA server?? 5-15+ minutes is waaaaaayyyy too long to find a match. 

Developers need to match up with randoms if the queue time exceeds 5 minutes or so, then I won‚Äôt be complaining either. Just match the queue algorithm of league of legends...otherwise 2 stars just because the game is actually decent.
review_title: Can‚Äôt even enjoy this game with friends

review: You get ready to play and boom game error you reload and can‚Äôt get back in your match just to get punished for the game error you can‚Äôt play 10-5 min because their game has bugs. Do to all of the game punishment less and less people are playing now. I have tried all most every match and had to wait 20+ minutes until I gave up just for a match. Just don‚Äôt waste money on this because it won‚Äôt be around long. Then there needs to be some balance with some of the classes, stun lock death every time , and longer spawn wait time as more punishment for death makes it less enjoyable. My suggestion play Hero‚Äôs of the storm from blizzard games much more balance with reasonable penalty, not stupid punishment for things out of your control.

review: I've been playing Wild Rift since season one, but everything changes after season three. All of the delightful experiences are gone, and any player who has played 800 games of rank can advance to master or grandmaster. Master and grandmaster are considered high tier ranks, but these players are so perplexing that nothing they did made sense. They wore Tristana on top and Teemo on the bottom. As if you needed to try as hard as you could to win every game you played. If a team game requires 5/10 effort, then this game requires 20/10 effort to win. And I was carried literally every game. This is so unfair; I despise spending money on this game because the troll teammates quickly bore you. I‚Äôm a challenger player since season 3, and now I feel like deleting my account is the best way to resist from playing this game. Absolutely atrocious!

review: It still very buggy. Seems there are major handicaps in some matches. Movement speed slows down for no reason. Damage doesn‚Äôt always register.. even to little minions. Sometimes minions do super damage and are aggressive enough to chase players past turret. I‚Äôve died for no reason a few times. I get rooted, and silenced by characters that don‚Äôt have those abilities many times each match. The item that can kill minions with low health that can be used on players‚Ä¶ often I use it on players with less than %5 health and the don‚Äôt die. I get locked into games that seem to be very rigged, and I‚Äôm being cheated by programming but I can‚Äôt leave without penalty. Why aren‚Äôt matches straight up, and fair?

Coming from League of Legends I got really excited to play Wild Rift and so far I have loved everything about it. For starters the game feels like LoL but with a fresh coat of paint and it feels so nice I mean have you seen Orianna she looks SO much better. Secondly I love that old items that a lot of people miss (Hextech Gunblade) have made its way into this game the items alone makes Wild rift feel less like League of Legends but it‚Äôs mobile and more of its own independent game. Thirdly I love the animations put into the game this shows Riot really loves their games and put care into this game which leads me to my one complaint WHY CAN‚ÄôT REGULAR LEAGUE look like this
review_title: My opinion on the game SO FAR

review: So first off the game is entirely free to play and putting money into your account does not increase your power or strength of any one specific champion‚Ä¶ every single purchase in this game is solely cosmetic‚Ä¶ that being said never played pc league but I truly have fallen in love with this game. If I might add one more thing ; the person below was accurate in one detail‚Ä¶ the matchmaking still needs revisited i believe, unfortunately the possibility of having huge skill gaps in ranked is more often than not‚Ä¶ other than that amazing game and keep up the beautiful work!
review_title: The dude below me is hilarious..

review: I didn‚Äôt have a pc to play league on the computer so having wild rift was a blessing because I was able to play for the first time. Eventually I did get a pc but I still love playing both on the phone and the computer! And honestly the mechanics of the game on the phone is very user friendly and make it easy for a new comer to figure out how to use a champion. And since the map is much smaller I don‚Äôt have to worry about being in a game for almost an hour. But still probably shouldn‚Äôt try playing while at work or on some short break

After playing the game for 40 days and reaching emerald two , having played its competitor mobile legends for 4 years the game need a lot of work the ping is always unstable and spikes high due to being matched up with players from South American countries which makes communication along teammates much harder even tho the game says I‚Äôm on North America server. there is no player banning or any support as for players with negative behavior, the system only detects when someone goes AFK not when they intentionally feed. I‚Äôve had players with 1/16/1 KDA and they did not get banned after being reported. This game seriously needs harsher banning punishments and two servers for NA and SA. I Expected more from a game that has been out on computer for so long.
review_title: Fun but needs lots of work

review: I‚Äôve always been a bit overwhelmed by League and never got into it. Everyone besides me seemed like they knew what to do and I was lost. I was also put off by the game having its own launcher on PC instead of a traditional game menu, and not being on Steam didn‚Äôt help things. But this version not only has a great interface, it‚Äôs got great tutorials and is easy to learn. It‚Äôs also got better graphics and animations than the PC version. I am now more open to playing League regardless of platform than I have ever been...please bring this to consoles with cross play and update the PC version too!
review_title: Well, you finally got me to play League

review: The game is terrible. You get stuck with people who are no where near the same rank as you and you get randoms who will afk and leave the game. There is no afk safety guard so you get punished as well in rank when someone afks. Wildrift is terrible for any decent player. They refuse to fix their issues that have been happening for months all so you can find quick matches. They also give you people who are too low to rank with you but somehow still find their way into your lobby. The game has gotten so bad you might as well unistall. You get punished for going pvp and punished for ranking. They don‚Äôt care who you get and often you end up with such lopsided teams that the game almost seems so unbearable. And the recent fixes coming up have nothing to do with fixing any of these issues.

Compared to the other mobile mobas out there , they honestly do not compare to the level of polish on this one. Vainglory, MLBB, AoV, onmyoji arena just to name a few. Although decent in their own right do not receive the same level of developer support that this one does, constant updates, transparency with the community. The ability to obtain the heroes by just playing and collecting BE makes it way more accessible than others. There are events nearly weekly. Safe to say I won‚Äôt be playing any others.
review_title: Other mobile mobas do not receive as much support not even close

review: Qualms about the game itself aside, the app took forever to install, and then as soon as I finish the tutorial, it said a new version was available and wouldn‚Äôt let me continue without updating. You‚Äôd think the version I‚Äôd downloaded 10min before would be at least up to date enough to tide me over for a few days, if not the latest version. Actually, no, /you‚Äôd think it‚Äôd just be the latest version/ . I even tried uninstalling and reinstalling (bc I‚Äôm petty), and it still said it had to update after finishing the tutorial. Here‚Äôs a thought: make an app that can be installed in one go. The ‚Äúupdate‚Äù is over 1.5GB, btw. So I guess that makes this an almost 5GB app. It also has given me a 10+ min ETD every time I‚Äôve started downloading itüò© smh

review:
So this is optimized for iPad, but man idk it should be quicker on mobile version than the pc game. I‚Äôm not trying to kill my iPad or phone for long games. That being said, I‚Äôve played league on pc for years and it really pisses me off that content I have already bought they want you to rebuy in the mobile version. For real riot, how much money do you want from us. It really leaves a bad taste in my mouth. 

Also tbh it feels really off for the controls if you‚Äôre used to the pc version. The map in top left always throws me off and the mechanics feel clunky in this. Also suggested item build paths sometimes don‚Äôt make sense, but it seems like they think mobile players don‚Äôt care as much as itemization.
review_title: Clunkier than pc and makes you rebuy content

review: Play Wild Rift for these 2 days have been amazing I‚Äôm not a big mobile person but playing a iconic game like these on the go or when just chilling on your bed is perfect. The game feels really smooth and runs really well on a iPhone 6 when running at both 30 to 60 FPS and it doesn‚Äôt take up much battery life you can play this game hours on end. These game will forever be that game I can play when I‚Äôm at school bored or on the go it keeps you entertained and is something for you and friends to do or fun. Keep it up Riot Game hope there is more to Wild Rift in the future
review_title: League of League wherever you go is legendary

review: Trolls run rampant and Riot does nothing to punish them. Unbalanced champs that one shot you when fed (and even when behind for some of them) and you watch helplessly as that champ gets a triple kill on your idiot teammates. Riot clearly does not intend to fix their matchmaking system that is built to keep you at a 50% win rate to keep you playing and the massive amounts of trolls. Additionally, you can get auto filled and end up wasting 30 minutes of your life playing a role that you don‚Äôt like. The paid currency is also scummy since you can‚Äôt buy the exact amount for a skin and you will always have some left over. Would not recommend, go play a game with devs that actually care about their player base because Riot‚Äôs only success is creating a machine designed to create human suffering.

You think this wouldn‚Äôt be a issue but lately all my matches have been with people that only speak Spanish like no joke. It‚Äôs already hard enough having to type quickly in chat too give enemy information but when either players can‚Äôt understand each other I‚Äôm starting to see that I probably shouldn‚Äôt even have team chat on and just focus even more on my own gameplay which is hard enough because I‚Äôm already ahead of the match but I cannot help win the match any longer because my team has fed to the point that I can‚Äôt even help them in team fights some quick ideas for this sorta issue is either too make a preference for language players or a in game language translator

review:
4 stars because it‚Äôs league of legends on mobile! What more can I say? The only bad thing right now are the servers, every time I get into a big teamfights the whole game lags, it‚Äôs not even the frame rates it‚Äôs the whole ping! It has cost me more than a few games already and it‚Äôs getting severely annoying.

Edit 1: Docking it at a 3 star now, my game has been crashing repeatedly. Restarted my iPad and everything to get it straight yet it still crashes consecutively 2+ times each match. Costed me a lot of matches and I‚Äôm probably going to get banned out of games the next time it happens. Also add a rank protection from people afking. It‚Äôs really annoying to see your teammate just boot out of the game and leave everybody for dead and loss.

I like to read the one star ratings and go from there. I play league and I‚Äôm in love with the game. So I understand when people say there‚Äôs no real skill in rift and it‚Äôs all auto attacks and 1v5 penta kills all around and such. I get it this game is nothing compared to league. But it‚Äôs not league it‚Äôs wild rift. It‚Äôs a way to play the game during your 30min break. While being bored at a party wanting only to be home playing league. Don‚Äôt bag on it for the fact that it‚Äôs not league. And except it for what it is. A way to play away from home and from the convenience of your phone.

I kind of liked this game in the beginning but there were toxic players and people who just abandoned you. It was extremely hard to move up the ranks with these teammates. Also, the ban thing is stupid because you literally have a WiFi issue then the games just like, ‚Äúoh you‚Äôre banned, we don‚Äôt give a about your WiFi. Then after a while it starts banning you for extremely long times. And on top of all that, the player support never answers you. Ever. You email them then they ask for you to put Ina ticket. Then you respond and say you sent the ticket, and it asks for you to put in a ticket, so on. And finally if they ever answer they just say, ‚Äúsorry, that looks like a you problem‚Äù ie. They don‚Äôt care or quote on quote, cannot fix it. That‚Äôs why the game is so trash.

This game is nothing but a bad replicant of the PC version. It copied only the worst part: the unbalanced champ strength and the torturous ELO system. What‚Äôs worse, it even copied Honor of Kings, bringing in the stupid mirror
-image map system. Both the PC League of Legends and the Honor of Kings, though are controversial, can be called well-made. However, this game just chose to pick the worst part of both games and stick them together. Although it has the name of league of legends, it is a completely different game where champs have ultimate skills at lv5 and all kinds of PC league of legends knowledge are irrelevant. It would have been great if it just copied the PC version, but instead the designers chose to pursue what they called ‚Äúcreativity‚Äù by copying another game‚Äôs systems. Now it is just a boring and bad replicant of the two games.
review_title: The Worst and Most Boring Replicant

review:
Game is amazing. The feeling of actual league on the go just blows other mobile moba games out of the water. 

 My biggest concern is matchmaking with non-English speakers. Literally I am the only person that speaks English and no one could understand me. That drives me nuts so communication was extremely difficult not sure if other players across the world are being match made with me or not or they were a premise group.

Also the bug that most yasuo mains are complaining about is fixing the airblade combo. It‚Äôs driving me nuts that we have to run in the same direction as our dash continue to hold that position until the ult is done. Please fix that! As I do spend my time and money on this game because I enjoy and love this game.
review_title: Very fun but needs more improvements

review: Hi  I been playing LOL on pc for a while until I discovered ML  I respect both games but ML on mobile version is so far best, graphics sound effects hero action during game and attacks effect. LOL it's a computer game and should remain like that if ur not gonna try and be twice better then ML, I played the game now and I was streamy disappointed y'all made it exactly like on pc. It's 2021 not 2009, so please upgrade this hero's effects and sound effects.  ML hero's like Roger you can see his movement attack clearly and fast not in slow mo like the hero's in LOL. Some people might not notice that but when your playing a much better game, small things like that are noticeable. LOL so far is boring and even Arena valor still  better then LOL, stand no chance against Mobile legend.. and don't be making expensive skins like ML do better.

My friends all give me a hard time about playing this game, but I enjoy the heck out of it. They all have a bad taste in their mouths about desktop LoL. I do too, if I‚Äôm being honest.  This is a lot more fun, and I love being able to play games almost anywhere on phone or tablet. Since SEMC abandoned their amazing game VainGlory last year to focus on something new and stupid, this is by far the best MOBA on mobile. 

I really enjoy that this doesn‚Äôt feel like a pay-to-win game. You can spend real money on cosmetic stuff, and to unlock heroes faster, but you can honestly earn enough of the free in-game currency just by playing that you can buy almost any hero you want with just a few days of very casual play, so you don‚Äôt need to spend any money to have a lot of fun.

My main gripes:
1. Virtual joysticks work okay, but I‚Äôd honestly prefer tap controls like VainGlory used to have. 
2. If you‚Äôre going to use virtual joystick and buttons, why not enable real controller support?
review_title: Lot of fun, even if you don‚Äôt like LoL

review:
This game is designed to get you addicted and wanting more. Specifically matchmaking will gove you sever good pairings so you feel good and confident. Then, you will find yourself on a 5 game horror fest of trolls, afk, or just absolutely bad players and or a combination of that and a 5man almost pro enemy team with you band of losers to go up against. I truly believe matchmaking is designed to let you have fun and the. Cut you down with a slew of losses to get you to play more so you can get another win. 

On top of that, there are a large number of seriously broken champions that they never actually fix. And each season your ranked status is massively reset to lower tiers which creates an unhealthy grind and also makes match making extra bad in early season due to high elo getting mixed in with low elo.

I use to play pc lol all the time but unfortunately with how long those games are it was dreadful spending an entire hr on 1-2 games. I love how fast pace this is with increased xp and spawn time for minions (5-25min games.) If you‚Äôre in a bad game being griefed or taken hostage usually they go by fast so it‚Äôs not as hurtful as the pc toxicity. Not all the champs are in but I‚Äôm ok with that as they cover most of the popular/easy to play champs. The only downfall I‚Äôd say is ranked is really easy to climb compared to pc. Feels like now ranked is on dbd where if you just play enough games you‚Äôll climb no matter what.

In my current ELO (Gold 1), I feel like everyone I‚Äôm matched up with and against are former active LoL players like myself because it seems like everyone knows what they‚Äôre doing which means less ping spams and less toxicity. There‚Äôs one caveat that stands out from their desktop counterpart that I truly love and that is having to type on the virtual keyboard! There is definitely less chat abuse simply because it is difficult to type on it lol. Overall this mobile version is a 4.5/5 because it is not a full champion roster (and no Anivia love! Waiting for a CG movie of her)‚Ä¶ yet
review_title: Casual Gaming for a Former PC Gamer

review: This game has the potential to be something great. However, when you‚Äôre someone like me who doesn‚Äôt have people to play with and has to chance playing with randoms every game then it‚Äôs extremely unplayable. I have been stuck in the emerald 1 and dia 4 rank. ALL because teammates give up or afk players, the intentional feeding, throwing games on purpose has increased so much of late that you really can‚Äôt enjoy this game at all. I don‚Äôt recommend anyone who doesn‚Äôt have a full team of 5 to play ranked at all. It‚Äôs rigged against you. You can preform in 90%+ bracket every game and you still somehow get people who play like they have never played this game before. I just don‚Äôt understand the matchmaking in this game. 8/10 games is like this. Avg 18-22 mins a game. It‚Äôs a waste of time.
review_title: If I could rate 0, I would.

review: Ok first off I gotta say that this game is super addicting but yet fun!! If your the type of person that loves combat and competing than this game is definitely for you my friend!. As soon this game was done downloading I chose my favorite champion which is Jinx, and I began to complete tutorials and matches. And not gonna lie I fell in love with the game. So I definitely recommend this game for anyone who wants to play it and props to Riot Games for this amazing game. P. S: if you want to watch a show produced by Riot Games and Netflix than I recommend the netflix show base off the two champions Vi and Jinx. The show is called Arcane.

I am not saying because it happened one or two times; I am complaining because it happened in every game. Especially in Howling Abyss dude. My team had 2 gold, 2 platinum and 1 emerald and the enemy side had 2 master, 1diamond, and 1 GRAND MASTER. Are even kidding me? It happened in a row. Not only on my side; I also had team way to high leveled players compared to enemy team and I obviously yes, we did won that time and I felt bad for enemy team. Dude, fix your matchings. It is a complete unfair and unbalanced match. I know it is not effecting ranks, but still. Who wants to play game that is unfair?

I got this game just recently but have been playing it so so so much with my friends. It is so fun and I love the portability of being able to play anywhere. 

My one wish for this game is keyboard and mouse support. I play on an iPad and the graphics and everything are all amazing‚Ä¶ but i would love the choice of being able to play with my magic keyboard. I am definitely not the only one with this wish. It would change how us mobile players can actually experience the game. PLEASEEEEE!!

other than that, as a new player to the entire LOL community and game, i am having so much fun.
review_title: Almost Perfect‚Ä¶ Would Love Keyboard & Mouse support!!!

review: So the game play is smooth when lag or connection issues are not at okay.  The character models are sweet they look fantastic, I wish they could port that back to the PC version.  Yes it is a mobile game, and not as reactive as PC, but it is a great alternative to a 30+ min game of LOL.  My major complaint is network stability even on Wi-Fi, and lag from that is often times makes it hard or discouraging to play in ranked.  All in all a great game, and I know we are in beta so keep up the great work!  Between TFT,LoR, and wild rift Riot is taking it to the competition on every game genre.
review_title: LOL on Mobile, plus best Mobile MOBA

review:
I would like skins I have paid for in the original to be available to me on here without having to pay for them again. Also, I can‚Äôt wait to get out of noob ranks. It‚Äôs frustrating when people aren‚Äôt looking at the map and leave you alone to defend dragon against 2 enemies for most of the game and they still lose bot and mid. 
Other than that, it‚Äôs a great game and I enjoy it a lot! Really fun and addicting! I personally prefer the joystick controls, but I think there should be more options for other people who want a different way to move about.
review_title: Would really like to have cross purchases.

review: It‚Äôs insane that I‚Äôm current diamond and I can‚Äôt even enjoy pvp. I solo w and every single match all I play are challenger and grandmaster nerds who are playing in full stacks. 0 type of matchmaking it‚Äôs insane the company will chat ban you but place you against a full team of Chinese players who are all challenger but expect you not to lash out at your team when you‚Äôre the only one who‚Äôs positive. Im done playing wild rift forever im on a 7 game losing streak I went from em 4 with 5 crystals an 2 loss protection back down to play 1 I‚Äôve had people selling matches all day or even leaving lane at 1 minute in the game this is beyond trash an they were diamond players
This game has the dumbest most belligerent players in the entire world an NA has the worse match making either no one speaks English so you can‚Äôt communicate with your team an if they do speak English all they do is be racist  or they don‚Äôt ping or even pay attention to the map an when you report them riot does nothing at all this games is physically an mentally with nothing to gain from it at all an I‚Äôve been playing support league on pc since 2013 an they game has to has some of the worse players of all

It‚Äôs a great game, but definitely not the best game in the App Store. This style game has a good fan base but it‚Äôs not for everyone. Who voted? That being said I believe the Apple App Store has suffered in gaming diversity and strict regulations and policies that have taken away from the gaming experience. I hope Apple is forced to make changes to the App Store. They have no competition which reflects in the service they provide. With an open App Store I believe we‚Äôd see changes for the best interest of the consumer. I wasn‚Äôt invited to vote for game of the year but if I was voting for anything it would be a open app platform for all phones. I‚Äôve played more games than most on iOS. I give this one 3 stars üòä

The patches are rolling in constantly tuning champion gameplay, they‚Äôre an active social media account keeping you well informed, it looks/plays great on your phone or tablet, has great guides with different tips or tricks.....it‚Äôs everything the PC version is not and that‚Äôs a good thing. Call this ‚Äútinkering‚Äù with an established product a great way for a new generation of players to experience the fun of this game LITERALLY at your fingertips . This has to be one of the BEST free games EVER.

I am sort of a new player (dabbled in original League, nothing to boast about) prior to my indulgence in this Wild Rift review.

Stop forcing us to play the tutorial when we download the game. Its already an option to do tutorials if someone so chooses or if you are a new account it makes/rewards you for going through them. It stops the downloading process until you finish/skip the tutorial, making the downloading process not smooth at all. I can‚Äôt just download the app and walk away. I have to sit over my phone and go through multiple steps to get to the point where I can play. I have to download the app, open it, download the tutorial, skip it, start downloading the game, confirm that I want to download a package that size then finally download the game. Is it too much to ask for a game that when I click download in the App Store and when its done downloading I can play it?

review: League of Legends: Wild Rift feels significantly more enjoyable to play over the PC counter part. The game is built from the ground up and is extremely polished, the ranked system is MILES better than the PC counterpart. Games are really short compared to the PC 20-40 minute games, which allows fast paced action and quick thinking macro play, The controls are fantastic and responsive, And the constant updates with new champions and events keep the game fresh. The team behind Wild Rift clearly puts a lot of passion and love into their game, and it shows.

I‚Äôve been playing PC LoL since Neeko came out and this is a great mobile version. The graphics are really pretty and I‚Äôm not the biggest fan of the condensed map and how lane mirroring is handled  but sometimes I encounter this bug where if I can‚Äôt connect to a match it puts me through an endless loop of Reconnect prompts till I cancel and repair the app instead of trying to log back in, which if I do log back in after canceling it sends me through the looped prompts again. I‚Äôm glad it doesn‚Äôt punish me for this but it‚Äôs still annoying.
review_title: Love it but it has an annoying bug

review: I like league of legends. The concept is fun the charcters are nice. But unless you have amazing connection you won‚Äôt be able to play and you will be banned. Yup this company for being such a long lasting game still hasn‚Äôt figured out the difference between afk and leaving intentionally, from being dc do to poor connection. So me having dc out of a few matches because my job takes me to new areas all the time have been banned for about 3 hours worth. It‚Äôs aggravating when you reconnected to the match and did your best to finish and still ge the ban. Cause geuss what there‚Äôs no warning and defintly no support. So gg devs you don‚Äôt have to do work and you got suckers to pay for this game. I want to be happy and give high reviews but I won‚Äôt ever for poor quality service.
review_title: They just don‚Äôt know how to fix it

review: First and foremost, I was a hardcore League of Legends player on the PC, and as my ‚Äúskill/knowledge of the game increased so did my passion for everything League. The Characters, the Lore, the Pro Scene, International Tourneys etc I was all in. So even though playing on the PC has definitely slowed down, I‚Äôve always wished that LoL had a mobile version to rival all the other crappy MOBAs, and after a long wait I finally was able to download Wild Rift on my iPhone 12 Pro. The game was ported so well onto handheld touchscreen controls. And as I‚Äôm playing the game I can just feel my old inner LoL player coming back.
review_title: Mobile LoL is exactly what I wanted.

review: The community is a coin flip with toxic behavior. The developers clueless about who really is toxic. In my experience, I literally only queued up for a game and decided simply not to after having to put a cap on playing a lot, for that I was given a warning of punishment for dodging the queue once. Well to bad there wasn‚Äôt a decline button to push so I can just leave the queue like PC League. I understand there is real intentional queue dodging but I only did it because there was no other choice but to accept the queue. So the developers should chill the F out over something trivial as occasional game dodging and only punishing the intentional game dodgers who repeatedly dodge. Nobody should get punished for leaving the queue every once in a while when you don‚Äôt know their reasons. Think Riot Think.

This is a great game but leaving a match to do something important is unfair I‚Äôll give you a example: You baby sister or son or daughter Neisse nephew exc. is taking their first steps so you close the game to take pictures. And now your ban for a hour it‚Äôs ridiculous I get some people do it because their mad or there trolling but banging people 
Left and right like this is just how you lose players. How about you take it and give a from of option to the other people in that game and ask if that players was being rude,not doing anything, blah blah bla. That way you don‚Äôt ban them they get mad and delete the game.

It‚Äôs good. The graphics are great, the balance is fine, there‚Äôs some nice features. However, it is currently basically unplayable because of the matchmaking.

The matchmaking desperately needs a rework. For some reason, Riot thinks that good players need to carry the burden of noobs who don‚Äôt know the absolute basics of laning, map awareness, etc. This leads to very lopsided games where a single decent adc on one team can literally carry the entire game. The matchmaking‚Äôs flaws aren‚Äôt even well-hidden, as this is an observable pattern in literally every game to every player. If Riot is going to matchmake by MMR, at least match players evenly, rather than make one player babysit someone with a sub 40% win rate.

The game itself is great. I quickly racked up 50 hours into the game in a month or so. It really reminded me of when I binged played Dota. One thing I didn‚Äôt like was that all hero‚Äôs weren‚Äôt available and you had to use in game currency to buy all the champions. I suppose that‚Äôs how they have to make their money now so not a big deal. What is a big deal is somehow my account became unlinked with my Apple ID. I contacted Riot support and they proceed to ask me questions about the games in Riot‚Äôs catalog (LoL, Valorant, and a few others) to verify my account, none of which I‚Äôve played before. There were no questions pertaining to Wild Rift. Apparently that wasn‚Äôt a satisfactory answer and they are unable to give me back my account. Be careful if you play this game using your Apple ID to log in.
review_title: Great game, terrible UX and support

review: I really enjoyed playing this game when I first started, but it has became very disappointing. I thought the reason to play ranked is to see where I stand in this game according to my skills. But the teammates that I was grouped with know nothing about their champions, this is just irregular in my opinion. I‚Äôm in platinum III, usually ppl in this level know what they are playing and how other champions work, but the teammates I got had no idea of anything. This game has became a disappointment, I think their evaluation system has huge problems.

review:
Update 2 months later all of this review is still TRUE:
Voice chat has been broken for a month now, there are other frequent issues and bugs. Matchmaking has also been broken since the new update where all matches are very one-sided. My friends and I rarely get an even match it‚Äôs either we completely blow the other team out of the water or we have to suffer through 15-20mins of horrible loss with no way to surrender since 2 teammates always vote no eventhough we‚Äôve taken zero turrets, dragons, and just lost baron. Probably going to stop playing, the bee Pok√©mon MOBA game looks interesting. We originally came from Brawl Stars and the polish of that dev team makes Wild Rift look awful.
review_title: Gameplay is good, but dev team is terrible

review:
During your rank promos you will get teammates who are complete noobs.  The system needs you to lose promos a few times and then let you win it after a few failures.  This method psychologically keeps players playing, but it‚Äôs retarded. 

Why is it retarded?  Because there are diamond players with a brain of a dumb baboon.  Because no matter how bad you are, the system makes sure that you will win some as long as you keep playing.  So no matter how bad you are, as long as you play you will climb the rank, and you will be a high rank noob who has learned nothing and ruin everyone else‚Äôs matches.  

The match making is not based on skills, it is based on time invested.  Time is money. They need noobs to buy skins too, and to keep the noobs they must feel the progress.

Literally unplayable.

Joking. Riot did an amazing job porting LoL to the phone. I actually like some of the controls better than on PC, but it is kind of annoying using the left thumb for walk but you get used to it. My arms hurt from playing this while laying down in bed. I look forward to playing this on the couch when I can‚Äôt be bothered to go sit at my computer, or when I am away from home. The lane swap thing threw me off for a minute when I went to the wrong bot lane, but it‚Äôs a great feature that I wish was available on PC. Overall it is an excellent game that I look forward to playing more.

I played League of legends and also lots of different mobile games like this. I can say this is the best I ever played. It has great graphics and controls, some games spend decades developing on mobile but can‚Äôt do nearly as smooth as Wild rift; The other thing I like about this game is it does not cost much battery, while usually one match cost about 15% of my iPhone battery, I can play more than 5 games on wild rift with 15% battery. And my iPhone is not heated up at all, they did a lot of things to make the game smooth and easy to play, I‚Äôd have to day, Riot, you did a great job.

Im only plat 1 but it makes it very hard to rank up when your forced to play with irons on your team who feed‚Ä¶. If i remember correctly its used to be a much smaller rank gap for who you play with. Being plat i should only be able to play with gold and emerald. This makes the games much more fair as you wont have some scrub on your team. A lot of people have smurf accounts so when you get a brand new player vs a smurf your going to automatically loose the game. Please fix this. I would rather wait longer periods of time to match with similar skill than be forces to play with irons and bronze. This should have never been a thing.

If you want a mobile game that requires Master‚Äôs thesis level research to be competent, this is the game for you. If you don‚Äôt already have hundreds of hours of experience with League of Legends, this may not be your thing. 

There are literally NINETY-EIGHT unique champions to learn and hundreds of items. It‚Äôs impressive and there is a ton to learn and explore. I 100% support that‚Ä¶for a desktop or console game. For Mobile it‚Äôs way too much. That is unless, as mentioned before, you are already very familiar with LoL. Trust me, your opponents are. If you‚Äôve been playing LoL for years, you will probably enjoy this. 

If you‚Äôre a casual fan, I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this.
review_title: Do 100 hrs of research before playing

review: It‚Äôs so stupid how you get banned from a match when you close your phone when u have to do something and get banned I have had to do a lot lately and had to leave a match and got banned a lot and I can‚Äôt help I got other stuff to do when I‚Äôm in a match I wish games didn‚Äôt put this in there game because it makes people not want to play it because they have something come up and can‚Äôt help that when they start a match then have to do something it‚Äôs so stupid I was so excited to play this game because of the arcane show and now I can‚Äôt even play it without getting banned from a match for two hours because I had to do something

It kinda brags about everything in the AD/commercial for it as if it‚Äôs somewhat better, and it says you need strategy and you can play this blindly and still win and it kinda brags about being super strategical and hard. And it says stuff about ‚Äúcollecting souls defusing bombs, pfffft that‚Äôs easy‚Äù and dark souls is an actual challenge. Like dark souls offers you a broken controller and them stabbing you in the knee caps 12 times and then cutting off your hands and then asking you to play with that broken controller. And this game you can blindly walk into it and walk out being victorious if you‚Äôre lucky, so this game has no real right to brag about anything when it is ‚Äúskilled-base‚Äù gameplay and very ‚Äústrategic‚Äù.
And by that I mean you can literally just walk in blindly and walk right out as a winner.

I downloaded League cause I wanted to see what was so fun about it and it turns out that it‚Äôs not even that fun. I mean, sure it has exciting things in it but the ban?? I just left a match for 5 minutes then I come back and it says I was banned for inappropriate behavior?? You guys need to fix that cause people are busy and they can‚Äôt finish a battle if they‚Äôre busy. Another thing, the whole longer the match, the longer it takes for you to get back in is complete trash. At least make it 15 seconds. My teammates were literally struggling to eat the enemy team and I can‚Äôt help them cause I need to wait 55 seconds to get back in. Like what‚Äôs up with that??

Game is good built of off the biggest moba around the only infuriating thing is the updates. some are in game and quick but when the app needs updating doesn‚Äôt auto update it seems. so you‚Äôll play it that day and randomly later there will be an update that doesn‚Äôt auto update so you have to download that which is is gonna be 1-3 gigabytes then you launch and has to verify and then download again something else usually under a gigabyte. So make sure to launch  if the app needs updating if you want to play when you have the time.

How hard is it to spend some time and money on fixing your algorithm for rank/leg rank games?

No one wants to grind their way to the top. People are willing to spend big money to buy skins and casually play and continue to challenge themselves in the rank leagues, but knowing that we all have to go through the dirty path of losing queue even if we are not deserving of it is a waste of my time and money. There are some people that do their due diligence to get the fundamentals bad learn the way and yet get thrown in the losing queue. Wake up! There are players that are naturally great at the game without wanting to grind the losing queue. 

It‚Äôs a total waste of our time and our monies and we would rather spend it somewhere else if you don‚Äôt fix this nonsense.

Hello, I‚Äôve been playing this game since release. Currently sitting in Emerald. I see a LOT of reviews talking about AFKs and DCs. Look, there‚Äôs always going to be an issue like that in games. What I can say is that the higher your rank, the less likely you are to get those players that ruin the game experience. Now, with that being said, those games are one in every 20 or so. 

Oh and there was one guy who gave a one star for the game having too many stuns. Don‚Äôt do this to game developers. That‚Äôs not a legit reason to report a one star. Get good.

I‚Äôve been playing off and on for 3 years. This new update has absolutely ruined all the competitive nature of the game. It‚Äôs encourages snowballed games, every. Single. Game. The baron spawns at 12 minutes. They have made the games so short to the point once you‚Äôre behind there is almost no chance to come back. Scaling is dead. There is no point in playing anything that doesn‚Äôt stomp lane as the game is over in we‚Äôll under 20 minutes. It feels way too fast and there is no longer the strategy of setting up ganks, slow pushes, and poke lanes. I‚Äôm pretty disappointed that they are trying to make this a casual ranked experience.

A great MOBA for mobile, it isn‚Äôt quite LOL but it‚Äôs remarkably close. I have played LOL for years and and it‚Äôs a great game but the mobile version will never be the same and I find that to be a good thing. The game isn‚Äôt perfect but what game is? There are very few flaws in the game and the ones that are will be easily corrected with future updates. Not all champions are in the game but again that will be easily fixed with future updates as well. If you looking to play LOL on your phone then don‚Äôt bother, but if you are looking for simply a great MOBA that‚Äôs easy to play with lots of diversity then I highly recommend Wild Rift.

why can‚Äôt u just fix the matchmaking man. i lost  17 games in rank in a row cuz of feeders or trollers or anything, i spent money on your stupid filing game cuz i enjoyed it but everyone at riot is just so blind, u never listen to any body so i seriously doubt you‚Äôll ever read my review, you‚Äôll never fix any matchmaking or understand the players experience when it comes to it, cuz riot is just another money hungry company who makes a quick buck off of everyone, i‚Äôve spent over 200 dollars on ur game, bought every single one of ur skins, and u give me troll after troll after troll after troll. i put in hours of my time to enjoy myself but rank isn‚Äôt fun anymore, norms isn‚Äôt fun anymore, u won‚Äôt ever read this. i wasted my time with ur company hoping you‚Äôd at least fix something, but u won‚Äôt.

review:
Good job on the game conversion from desktop to mobile, however it fails on two stars due to the following.

1. How is it that you allow us to use our desktop login info but nothing transfers over? Many of us have spent money and time to build our accounts. Now you want us to start all over again?ü§¶üèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

2. Three out of five times while loading into the game a message pops up saying I have been disconnected from the server. I try to login again and no luck. Then it brings me back to the sign in screen... When the game loads it works great but otherwise I have to take a chance if I'll be able to pay or not.

It is a good game because it is just pc league but that also means it shares it flaws and there are some questionable choices like why do you get bans for leaving unranked matches that should only be for ranked and why can‚Äôt I navigate the menu more while I queue. It is a great game if you like pc league but it sort of fails as a mobile game since if I had 30min to play a game I would get on my pc and play normal league. When I play a mobile game I need something I can play quickly. On the other hand if you don‚Äôt have a pc this is a great option if you want to play league.

I get that some champion skills are adjusted to suit the mobile style of wild rift but some changes or reworks are just atrocious. Like the whole point of soraka is to manager to hp pool. Lux‚Äôs E and Q being changed just to make her easier. Now with Janna, they essentially just made her into another lulu/sona type character‚Ä¶ In the second season, I managed to climb to GM with just Janna alone and now they just ruined her and removed any skill expression she had left. I came to wild rift so I can enjoy playing my main champions (the reason why I play league not just for rank) on the go. 
If I wanted to play an easier MOBA on the go, I would have downloaded MLBB. Please stop with these reworks, we don‚Äôt want your 5 year olds playing this game.

As someone who‚Äôs been playing League since season 2 I never thought we would see anything like it on a mobile platform however this game is a pleasant surprise. It gets about as close as you can get to the PC version. 

The game is fun to play. And definitely captures the feel of league extremely well and sets itself apart from other mobile based games In the MOBA genre.

The controls are probably the worst part about this game this title was meant for a mouse and Keyboard so obviously the controls won‚Äôt feel as smooth but that is to be expected.
review_title: Great game but could be even better.

review: I‚Äôve been playing wild rift for a bit now, started on iPhone 13 Pro Max w the 120hz refresh rate enabled. Game ran smooth but phone got hot and dimmed.. now, with my fancy new 14 pro max, 120hz isn‚Äôt supported and the game play is terrible! If there are more than two champions on the screen at a time it‚Äôs a glitchy, laggy mess. The 60hz refresh rate TO ME, Makes this game really crumby to play, granted my device no longer heats up or dims but I would take the old problems over the new. Very hard to land skill shots when my champion and all animations are delayed or blurred. I‚Äôm contemplating waiting to play until the update for 120hz support comes out‚Ä¶ this game is too much for a 60hz device
review_title: Poor quality experience on iPhone 14 pro

This is the best mobile moba since vainglory died. Champs are great, no p2w, roles are different, lanes are unique. It‚Äôs good 5v5 fun. The only thing holding it back is the matchmaking. It‚Äôs pretty bad. People who intentionally are bad don‚Äôt get punished enough. You will play games you have no shot at winning because your teammate will afk and get a minor penalty while you waste 15 minutes of your life trying to surrender and your teammates think they can win 5v4. Or, somebody dies 0/2 in the first 5 minutes then spends the rest of the game at the base or feeding calls the remainder of the game. If they gave out punishments to deter that behavior, and made the matchmaking better, this is easily a 5 star game.

Riot has really outdone themselves with Wild Rift.  It‚Äôs freaking amazing and for those that don‚Äôt know, it‚Äôs not a pay to play game. Yes if you want all the champions sooner then yeah you will have to pay for them, but if not then just grind out for the Blue Essence.  Ranked is toxic just like the PC platform, but what ranked gaming community isn‚Äôt toxic. I look forward to seeing more and more champions released.  If you enjoy league, definitely download this.  It may not be as good as PC, but it sure as heck is close.  It‚Äôs a lot easier too than PC in my opinion.  Good job on this one Riot. üëçüèºüìà

Here‚Äôs the deal, I‚Äôve never ever given the moba genre a chance. Never seemed like my type of game.
Hi we‚Äôre now playing this I can‚Äôt stop I even have had dreams about the game, it‚Äôs crazy how addicted I‚Äôve become.
One thing I do see in the reviews is PC players trying to compare them. They are two completely separate platforms and they should not be compared in any sense. 
I can‚Äôt say anything regarding the pc version as I‚Äôve never played, but respect the fact that a mobile game won‚Äôt be as responsive or as good as something made for the pc.

There is zero liability for intentional feeders and trolls. Riot doesn‚Äôt care. As long as the account gives them money they‚Äôll never face a ban from the game. People have proven this. Purposely troll 30+ games in a row with ZERO CONSEQUENCES. Riot has known this for over a year and have done nothing. Reports don‚Äôt do anything. They‚Äôre just a placebo button. Again, proven over and over. Riot has admitted reports are for ‚Äúresearch‚Äù and anytime Riot uses that excuse it‚Äôs always leads to the community finding out they‚Äôre doing nothing with it. Unless they find something that supports their lazy ways. Like not implementing the behavioral system from the Chinese version. Because ‚Äúit doesn‚Äôt work‚Äù according to the group making the global version. Let that one sink in.

review: The porting of this game has failed. Therefore, the low popularity of this game is an inevitable result. It has been almost half a year since the server was opened, and the popularity in various regions has been very sluggish. The reasons are as follows: (1) The game is not casual enough and it is very tiring to play. (2) The stationing operation of PC is not suitable for transplanting to mobile phones. (3) Overly unbalanced matching mechanism, playing without any sense of accomplishment. (4) There are already around 65 heroes, but only a few can play. (5) Some heroes have failed to transplant, such as Timo and Galen's R. (6) The damage of some heroes is too outrageous, and the damage of some heroes is too low. (7) The attack speed bonus is too low, causing the game feel to be too bad.
review_title: I have uninstalled the game and will never come back
